She is grateful to FUSAI who have put their faith in her, and she will do everything possible not to miss any payments.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to the kitchen area, buying sheet metal and wooden beams to improve her home

loans.name: Pandora

texts.en:
People in the village where Pandora resides have been commenting on her being happy almost all the time and also on her personality. Here is what some of her neighbors said: “It’s really a blessing having her live next to you. She has this good energy that she sends to you as soon as you meet with her. It’s just awesome. And your day goes just smooth afterwards.”

Pandora lives in a little town in the southeastern part of the country, but despite the fact that she lives in a town, she runs an agricultural activity in her village.

“I live in the town because my kid is still attending high school, and we lack such a school in the village. Otherwise, we would live in the village, because in my heart, I will always remain that ‘villager’,” she said, sighing. 	

With this loan, Pandora would like to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Efua is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fried fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fried fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a car washing machine and renovate his car wash

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing cloth inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of sewing material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital to perform more money transfers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. As a widow with 8 children, Abena uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Abena will use the loan to purchase more limes, which will help her improve her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more limes, which help her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more garden eggs, tin tomatoes, pepper, salt, onions, and spices, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began eight years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. However she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she aims to use her loan to purchase more limes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more limes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of charcoal to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has four children. Although she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize to make Kenkey.

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is 40 years old. He operates a butchery and this has been his business for the last three years. He started the business by buying and selling cattle and goats, and with time he built his own butchery and now does everything on his own. 

Mgandi see an opportunity to start a food canteen in the area where he operates the butchery, and so this is what he is targeting. He seeks a loan to buy flour, beans, kale and cooking oil.

Mgandi is family man with five children to take care of. His business is the sole source of income for him and his family. He wants to grow his business to a point where he will be able to win big tenders. The major challenges that he faces in the business include inadequate financing and price changes. The extra income that he will raise will help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, kales and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Emissakrom, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Ekua is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels; hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business; thus, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels; hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married with four children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family have no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Brenda sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Brenda's goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education; yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for a number of years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of limes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of limes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries to re-sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Even though she did not receive any formal education, Araba is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast), and she has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. 

Araba is a widow and has one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Araba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She operates a food stand in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for her food, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for her food

loans.name: Suzzy

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Suzzy did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Suzzy sells secondhand clothes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about seven years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have four children. Suzzy uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of secondhand clothes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish and oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She sells her products on a door-to-door basis. She works six days a week. She has requested UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to open up a stall at the market. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has one child. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She sells secondhand clothes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast), and has been actively involved in this business for about four years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Bianca

texts.en:
Meet Bianca. She used her first Kiva loan to increase the working capital for her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan helped her to serve her customers much faster, and she is now able to pay out large amounts of money without worrying about converting funds from electronic to cash.  Bianca wants to let her Kiva lenders know that her profits have improved, and this has helped her move to a better house and send her four-year-old daughter to nursery school.

Bianca is now applying for a second Kiva loan which she plans to use to finance a second Zoona money transfer shop in her town of Kapiri-Mposhi.  Bianca’s new outlet will offer mobile money transfers and Mobile Airtime to more rural customers. With this loan, she will be able to buy a new trading booth and a new phone, and she will use the remaining funds as a working capital float for her money transfer outlet.  

Bianca is hopeful that once she opens her second shop, her revenue will double and she will be able to improve her education through distance learning. She would like to go back to school and repeat the subjects that she did not do very well in during high school, so that she can be a good example for her daughter. 

Bianca thanks the Kiva lenders for their support with the growth of her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: to open a second Zoona mobile money tranfer shop in her town of Kapiri-Mposhi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a Kiva borrower who is aged 59. He is married and has 6 children aged between 10 and 23 years. He describes himself as focused. He has taken a loan of KES 25,000 to buy a solar panel and a solar battery for lighting his house. They have no access to electricity at their house hence the need for solar lighting. They will be able to access light at night and reduce expenses by not buying kerosene. They will also be able to charge their mobile phones with the panel. He runs a retail shop to earn an income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in future he will be able to access electricity in his home.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells second hand clothes by retail. She has been in this  business for the last 5 years. She sells her products on a door-to-door basis. She works seven days a week. She has request UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Halima sells smoked fish at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for the last seven years. She earns additional income from selling second hand clothes at the market. Halima works seven days a week. Her major challenge is transportation. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy baskets of smoked fish.

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy baskets of smoked fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 33 years old. He is married and lives in Livingstone, Zambia. He runs a mobile money transfer business at the Kazungula border.  

This is Henry’s second loan; he has finished paying off his first loan, which helped him grow his business by increasing his working capital. He says he was able to serve even more customers. Henry explains that doing business at a border town requires a lot of working capital as most of his customers are in transit and need huge amounts of money to clear their goods. Henry is taking out another loan so that he can continue his business’s growth and so that he is not limited as to how many people he can serve in a day.  

Henry is hopeful that once the Kiva loan comes in, he will be able to serve his customers much faster and earn more profits. The profits will help Henry improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business by adding to his working capital float so that he can serve customers sending large amounts of money.

loans.name: Rakip

texts.en:
Rakip is an Egyptian Albanian who ‘fortunately’ (according to him), has chosen to live in the village and do something else for living, unlike the majority of his community who live in the suburbia and practice other activities such as buying & selling used or new items, recycling and handicrafts. Rakip is in the livestock business, and this makes him very happy with the choice.

“I am 38 and have four children to raise. I think no better way is raising them in the village with all the organic food and freedom to play outside. Five years ago, I started my livestock activity and this has been going well, no complaints, thank God,” said Rakip. "For me and my family, this is a dream come true; living in the village. Under the communist era, we couldn’t dare to think living elsewhere but the suburbia. We love the current system that gave us such great opportunities” he continued saying.  

Rakip wants to build the stable that you can see in the background of the photograph.

loans.use: to build the stable that you can see in the background of this photograph.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a retired civil servant, aged 65 years, and is applying for 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings. He is a borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI). 

After retiring from public service, he got himself into keeping cattle for commercial purposes. He sells milk from his two cows on a daily basis as his source of income. On top of daily income from selling milk, he also earns from a few rental houses that he built when still in public service.

He applied for the loan to purchase more two cows as a way of increasing his daily milk sales and income. Given the loan, he has hopes of having over 10 cows in the near future. He is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 5 years. Araba is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Araba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en: Besnik is running a better restaurant now, that is a fast-food one. Besnik said: "My income changed for the better and for all this improvement, I will have to thank all lenders. With the income I received, I bought the equipment for the new place. Yet, I am still in need of more equipment and this is why I am applying for another loan in hope that I will get some financial help. My wife is working here too."

loans.use: To buy equipment for his restaurant.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is single with four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Prossy sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for the last five years. She earns additional income from selling cassava chips at the market. Prossy works seven days a week, and she describes her major challenge to be transportation. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell at the market.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with one child who does not go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She sells her products door-to-door. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested 200,000 shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. 

Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina  é comerciante e tem 38 anos de idade. Vive na casa própria, é casada e mãe de 3 filhos, 2 dos quais estudam na 1ª e 3ª classes respectivamente e 1 é ainda muito novo.
Diz que ira comprar óleo, feijão, amendoim, cervejas e refrescos para reforçar o seu negocio - tem uma mini mercearia em casa.
No futuro tem planos de ampliar e mobilar a sua casa.
Diz que irá pedir mais créditos para realização de seus planos.
texts.en:
Cristina is a seller and she's 38 years old. She lives in a house that she owns. She's married and has three children, two of whom attend 1st and 3rd grades respectively and one of them is still very young.
She states that she'll purchase cooking oil, beans, peanuts, beer and refreshments in order to boost her business - she runs a small grocery store from her home.
In the future she plans to enlarge and furnish her house.
She states that she'll request more loans so she can accomplish her plans.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, beans, peanuts, beer and refreshments in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
O Sr. António de 66 anos de idade, é casado e tem 8 filhos dos quais um está a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e 7 são independente e vivem nas suas próprias casas. Ele è operário agrícola numa empresa de produção da banana.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos, portas, janelas e pagamento de transporte) para dar continuidade à sua casa.
O Sr. António tem com esperança terminar com a sua casa e pedir mais empréstimos na Hluvuku-Adsema para a construção do muro da sua casa.
texts.en:
António is 66 years old and married. He has eight children, one of whom attends elementary school and seven are independent and live in their own homes. He's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, bricks, doors and windows) and pay for transportation in order to continue building his house.
António's hope is to finish his house and request more loans from Hluvuku-Adsema so that he can build a wall around his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, bricks, doors and windows) and pay for transportation in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
Matilde é comerciante, tem 45 anos de idade, é viúva e tem 4 filhos. Vive na casa própria e sustenta também 1 neto.
Com o valor deste crédito ira comprar cimento e areia para fazer blocos para iniciar a ampliação de sua casa com uma sala pois agora só tem 2 quartos.
No futuro gostava de terminar a sua obra e mobilar a casa para dar melhor condições de vida à sua família. Diz que irá pedir mais empréstimos para realizar o seu plano e compromete se  a pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Matilde is a seller. She's 45 years old and a widow, and she has four children. She lives in a house that she owns and also supports a grandson.
With the amount of this loan she'll purchase cement and sand for making bricks. That way she can begin enlarging her house by adding a living room, since currently it only has two bedrooms.
In the future she'd like to finish building and furnishing her house in order to improve her family's living conditions. She states that she'll request more loans so she can achieve her plan, and she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for making bricks so she can begin enlarging her house.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
Carlota, casada, mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também 3 sobrinhos e uma enteada que vivem com ela. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de cinco anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 13.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho iniciar um projecto de avicultura e o principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Carlota is married and has four children who attend different schoolgrades. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports three nephews and a stepdaughter who live with her.
She has been in retail (she sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over five years.
With the current loan for 13,000mt she intends to purchase more merchandise so that she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dream is to start a poultry raising project, and her main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for selling.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.pt:
Dulce, casada, mãe de 1 filho que frequenta escola e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sogra e sobrinha que vivem noutra casa. 
É avicultora (dedica-se a criação e venda de frangos) há mais de sete anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 30.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais pintos, racção, vitaminas e vacinas para responder a demanda reforçando o negócio.
Tem como sonhos ver seu filho com o nível superior concluído e de adquirir uma viatura pessoal. Tem como principais desafios a Newcastle e a especulação de preços no mercado.
texts.en:
Dulce is married and has a son who attends school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports her mother-in-law and her niece who live in another house.
She has been a poultry farmer (she raises and sells chickens) for over seven years.
With the current loan for 30,000mt she intends to purchase more chicks, feed, vitamines and vaccines so she can meet the demand by bolstering her business.
Her dreams are to see her son graduate college and to acquire a vehicle for personal use. Her main challenges are Newcastle disease and price speculation in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, vitamines and vaccines for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Friselio

texts.pt:
Frizélio, solteiro, não tem filhos, vive na casa dos pais e não sustenta a ninguém. 
É docente de profissão.
Com o presente empréstimo de 30.000,00mt pretende adquirir material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, pedra, aros de janela e portas) para concluir com a sua obra.
Tem como sonhos abrir uma Reprografia e concluir sua obra. Seu principal desafio é falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Friselio is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in his parents' house and doesn't support anyone.
He works as a teacher.
With the current loan for 30,000mt he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron rods, rocks, window frames and doors) in order to finish his construction work.
His dreams are to open a print shop and to finish the construction work. His main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in the business.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron rods, rocks, window frames and doors) in order to finish his construction work.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Filomena, solteira, mãe de 5 filhos, um vive com ela outros com o pai e vive na casa própria. 
É comerciante (vende vestuário, camas e cobertores) há mais de seis anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 8.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais roupa, camas e cobertores para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho construir uma casa própria e tem como deseafio satisfazer a demanda.
texts.en:
Filomena is single and has five children, one of whom lives with her and the others live with their father. She lives in a house that she owns.
She has been a seller (she sells garments, beds and blankets) for over six years.
With the current loan for 8,000mt she intends to purchase more clothing, beds and blankets so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dream is to build a house of her own, and her challenge is to meet the demand.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.pt:
Jacinto casado e pai de 1 filho que não frequenta escola e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a seus irmãos que vivem na mesma casa. 
É comerciante (vende vidros, portas e outro material de construção) há mais de dez anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais material de construção para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho construir um estabelecimento comercial e não tem desafio.
texts.en:
Jacinto is married and has a son who doesn't go to school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his siblings who live in the same house.
He has been in retail (he sells glass, doors and other construcion supplies) for over ten years.
With the current loan for 20,000mt he intends to purchase more construction supplies so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dream is to build a store, and he doesn't face any challenges.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (glass, doors and other supplies) for selling.

loans.name: Sabado

texts.pt:
Sábado, casado, pai de 1 filho menor de idade e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também seus sobrinhos órfãos de pais que não vivem com ele. 
É cabeleireiro (presta serviços de decoração de cabelos) há mais de dez anos.
Com o presente empréstimo de 12.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais mexas, soft free, revelon, reston e darlin love aumentando para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos experimentar novos serviços comerciais, fazer um murro de vedação na sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o transporte. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para materializar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Sábado is married and has an underage son. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his nephews who have lost their parents and don't live with him.
He has been a hairdresser (he provides hairstyling services) for over ten years.
With the current loan for 12,000mt he intends to purchase more hair extensions and hair products of various brands so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dream is to try his hand at new commercial services, build an enclosing wall around his house and acquire a vehicle to make transportation easier. His main challenge is the lack of funds for making his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Olga casada e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis, mas os outros deixaram de estudar sem justa causa e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sogra que vive na mesma casa.  
É alfaiate (confecciona e vende vestuário) há mais de dez anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 25.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais tecidos para confecção de vestuário para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho adquirir máquinas de costura e peças para fabricar duves o principal desafio é a falta de capital para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Olga is married and has three children who attend different schoolgrades, although the others left school for no reason. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports her mother-in-law who lives in the same house.
She has been a dressmaker (she makes and sells clothing) for over ten years.
With the current loan for 25,000mt she intends to purchase more fabrics for making clothing. That way she'll meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dream is to acquire more sewing machines and supplies for making duvets. Her main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Relia

texts.pt:
Rélia, solteira, mãe de 2 filhos ambos que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família não sustenta ninguém. 
É comerciante (vende duves,mantas, biscoitos, bolachas, farinha de milho, trigo e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de cinco anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 8.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho continuar ver seus filhos envolvidos nos estudos e construir sua casa de alvenaria e o principal desafio é buscar fundos para investir nos estudos dos filhos (fazerem nível superior) e também na conclusão da obra da sua casa.
texts.en:
Rélia is single and has two children, both of whom attend different levels of school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she doesn't support anyone else.
She has been in retail (she sells duvets, quilts, cookies, crackers, cornflour, wheat and other household staples) for over five years.
With the current loan for 8,000mt she intends to purchase more merchandise so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dream is to keep on seeing her children engaged in their studies and build her house with brickwork. Her main challenge is seeking funds to invest in her children's education (send them to college) and also to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase various products (duvets, quilts, cookies, crackers, cornflour, wheat and other household staples).

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João, casado, pai de 4 filhos, uma que frequenta escola restante são menores de idade e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua mãe que vive noutra casa. 
É comerciante (fabrica e vende blocos) há mais dez anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais cimento para produzir mais para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho continuar com o seu negócio ajudando a população de Magude e o principal desafio é convencer o cliente a comprar os blocos antes de produzir.
texts.en:
João is married and has four children, one of whom attends school and the others are underage. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his mother who lives in another house.
He has been a seller (he makes and sells bricks) for over ten years.
With the current loan for 15,000mt he intends to purchase more cement so he can increase production and meet the demand by stocking up.
His dream is to keep his business afloat and help the people from Magude. His main challenge is convincing the customer to buy the bricks before he's made them.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other supplies for making bricks.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.pt:
César casado e pai de 3 filhos, 1 que frequenta escola e 2 menores, e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua irmã e 2 sobrinhos que vivem noutra casa. 
É pedreiro há mais de dez anos. Também é comerciante de carvão vegetal e lenha, a sua esposa apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais material de construção para terminar com as obras da barraca e da dependência para aluguer.
Tem como sonho concluir a dependência e a barraca, desenvolver actividade agrícola e aumentar o seu gado bovino. Tem como principal desafio falta de fundos para concretizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
César is married and has three children, one of whom attends school and two are underage. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his sister and two nephews who lives in another house.
He has been a bricklayer for over ten years. He also sells charcoal and firewood, and gets support from his wife in his business.
With the current loan for 13,000mt he intends to purchase more construction supplies so he can finish building a booth and a room for renting out.
His dream is to finish building the room and the booth, start a farming business and enlarge his cattle herd. His main challenge is the lack of funds for accomplishing his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies so he can finish building a booth and a room for renting out.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 35 years and is married with five children who are all school-going. He is a farmer mainly involved in the growing of maize for commercial purposes. Peter also has a poultry farm at his home operated by his wife as an additional source of income, especially when the season for maize is off.

Peter has approached Ugafode to get a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to be used for agriculture, especially for preparing the land for the next season, harvesting the current maize he has and also expanding the poultry business.

Peter's dream is to buy more land and start growing maize on a larger scale for more harvest and profits. However, Peter says that the major challenges to this are having limited capital, the seasonality for agriculture, as well as the price fluctuation for agricultural produce on the market. In the photograph, Peter is on the left, and the Ugafode credit officer is also shown in the client's maize garden.

loans.use: To hire labor for plowing the land and harvesting maize.

loans.name: Henrique

texts.pt:
Henriques casado e pai de7 filhos, 3 que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis, outros vivem juntados e são menores, e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também sobrinho e enteado que vivem com ele. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de dez anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 13.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho abrir um salão cabeleireiro e adquirir uma máquina fotocopiadora. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para desenvolver a actividade.
texts.en:
Henrique is married and has seven children, three of whom attend different levels of school. The other children are underage or live in common law marriages. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports a nephew and a stepson who live with him.
He has been in retail (he sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over ten years.
With the current loan for 13,000mt he intends to purchase more merchandise so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dream is to open a hairdressing salon and acquire a photocopying machine. His main challenge is the lack of funds for his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples).

loans.name: Sabado

texts.pt:
Sábado, casado, pai de 3 filhos, 2 que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e um menor de idade, e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua avô que vive noutra casa. 
É Guarda de profissão e a sua esposa é Empregada de Limpezas.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir material de construção para iniciar com as obras( CIMENTO, BLOCOS E OUTROS).
Tem como sonhos ter uma casa condigna, contrair o matrimónio e melhorar o emprego. Seu principal desafio é a falta de fundos para realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Sábado is married and has three children, two of whom attend different schoolgrades and one is underage. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his grandfather who lives in another house.
He works as a guard and his wife is a cleaner.
With the current loan for 10,000mt he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, etc.) in order to begin construction work.
His dreams are to own a decent home, get officially married and improve his career. His main challenge is the lack of funds for making his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, etc.) in order to begin construction work.

loans.name: Hamina

texts.pt:
Hamina, casada, não tem filhos e vive na casa própria. 
É comerciante (vende vestuário de segunda mão, roupa de cama e cigarros) há mais de quinze anos. Também é médica tradicional de profissão, o seu esposo apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais fardos de roupa para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos dar continuidade com as obras e fazer uma barraca e os principais desafios é concorrência no mercado e evitar clientes devedores.
texts.en:
Hamina is married and doesn't have any children. She lives in a house that she owns.
She has been a seller (she sells secondhand clothing, bed linen and cigarettes) for over fifteen years. She's also a traditional healer by trade, and her husband supports her in her business.
With the current loan for 15,000mt she intends to purchase more bundles for clothing so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to continue doing construction work and build a booth. Her main challenge is market competition and avoiding customers who are in debt.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.pt:
Ricardina, casada, não tem filhos e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua mãe que vive noutra casa. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz, farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de trinta anos e o seu esposo apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos construir quartos para aluguer e fazer um estaleiro. Seus principais desafios são: elevado custo da mercadoria, oscilação dos preços de mercado e de transporte.
texts.en:
Ricardina is married and doesn't have any children. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports her mother who lives in another house.
She has been in retail (she sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over thirty years, and her husband supports her in her business.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she intends to purchase more merchandise so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to build rooms for renting out and to build a storage yard. Her main challenges are the high cost of merchandise and the fluctuation of market and transportation prices.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples).

loans.name: Leocardia

texts.en: Leocardia is a widow who hails from Bubare in Mbarara district. She got married to the husband she loved but he later died. She has three children who are all in school. At the time she was widowed, she had no income generating business so she was able to begin trading in secondhand clothes. This is where she gets income for taking care of her children. With the first loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode, the business grew and she was able to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate the family. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to complete her house.

loans.use: To complete her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, accessories).

loans.name: Castigo Bernardo Fabiao

texts.pt:
O Sr. Castigo de 36 anos de idade, casado vive na sua propria casa tem 4 filhos dos quais 3 estao afrequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra sem idade para frequentar a escola nao tem nenhum dependente. Ele è  Operario Agricola numa empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construcao ( chapas, cimento, blocos, ferro, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
 Tem como esperanca melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar com fundos da hluvuku-adsema.
texts.en:
Castigo is 36 years old and married. He lives in a house that he owns. He has four children, three of whom attend elementary school and the other daughter hasn't reached school age. He has no other dependents. He's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, cement, bricks, iron, a door) and pay for labor in order to continue building his house.
His hope is to improve his diet and his living conditions with loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, cement, bricks, iron, a door) and pay for labor in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Alice Ernesto

texts.pt:
Sra. Alice de 35 anos de idade, solteira e tem 4 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela e negociante vende refecoes, refresco, cervejas a mais de 2 anos e uma actividade que esta a ser acompanhada com 2 auxiliares, actividade que consegue custiar as suas dispesas assim como adieta almentar dos seus filhos.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construcao (chapas de zinco, blocos, ferro, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and single. She has four children who attend primary and high school. She's a merchant and has been selling meals, refreshments and beer for over two years. She has two helpers in her business. Her business allows her to pay for her expenses as well as her children's dietary needs.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, bricks, iron, a door) and pay for labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, bricks, iron, a door) and pay for labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 34 años de edad, está casada con Salomón y tiene 03 hijos de 14, 06 y 02 años de edad de respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Nela se dedica a venta de ropas de segunda mano para damas, caballeros y niños, todos estos productos son adquiridos en el centro comercial de la ciudad, y los vende de manera ambulatoria por los pueblos alejados los cuales estan ubicados en los márgenes de los ríos, para eso realiza viajes hasta terminar de vender toda su mercadería y sin importar el tiempo que se demore. Se inició hace 06 años invirtiendo un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros, debido a la necesidad de contar con un ingreso para poder mantener a sus hijos. Lo considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que obtiene, ya que los vende a precios cómodos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo económico que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará mercadería para su negocio como ropas de damas, caballeros y niños de segundo uso, así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en: Nelly is 34 years old and has three children, ages 14, 6 and 2, with her husband Salmón. They live together in their own home. Nelly makes a living selling second-hand clothing for men, women and children. She acquires all of these products at the city's commercial center, and sells the items by travelling to the surrounding towns located on the riverbanks. She takes her trips and doesn't stop until she sells all of her merchandise, no matter the time. She started the business six years ago, investing her own savings out of the need to find a source of income to provide for her children. She considers it a lucrative business thanks to the good profits she makes, and she sells her products at affordable prices. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving that will allow her to make headway with her business, and she promises to make her payments on time. With the loan, she plans to purchase second-hand clothing for men, women and children so she has a stock of clothes ready to sell.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: “ESFUERZO DE MUJERES” es uno de los grupos puntuales en sus cuotas. Quienes se encuentran pasando el 03 ciclo. Hilda tiene 52 años es viuda desde sus 23 años se dedico a la venta de especerías y DVD. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado. El préstamo lo invertirá en la remodelación de puesto de trabajo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Hilda es la primera del lado izquierdo viste chompa verde.
texts.en: "Esfuerzo de Mujeres" (The Strength of Women) is a group that is punctual with its payments. The members are in their third loan cycle. Hilda is 52 years old and a widow. She has made a living for the past 23 years selling spices and DVDs. She currently sells food at a market. She plans to use the loan to remodel her sales post. The group is grateful for Kiva lenders for the loan. Hilda is on the left in the front row wearing a green sweater.

loans.use: to remodel a sales post.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 37 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 14. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a young lady, aged 28, who is married with three children. She lost both her parents when she was 8 years old and was staying with her grandmother until she got married at the age of 17 years. She got married to a man who also had a humble background, and because of such harsh conditions, they were forced to start up a small business dealing in the charcoal trade. It has grown with the support of loans from Ugafode, and they are now requesting 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to increase working capital in their business and buy more charcoal. In the photograph is Mary with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a permanent resident of Kabingo in Isingiro district. He is married with six children and four dependents. He grew up with only his mother, and  life was difficult in a single-parent household. Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used both as a source of food for the family and for income. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings to renovate his grandmother’s house since it is in a bad state.

loans.use: To renovate his grandmother's house.

loans.name: Evalist

texts.en:
Evalist is 33 years old and married with three children aged 6, 3 and 1. He operates a waragi trade business as his major source of income to look after the family and he has had this business for the last 10 years. Evalist borrowed UGX 1,000,000 from Ugafode previously to use in his business. He says the loan helped him to get profits which he used to start constructing a house for his family.

Evalist now wants another loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy material for completing the construction of his house. He hopes to pay back the loan in installments which will not affect his business.

Evalist has a dream of completing this house and having his family living in a good environment. However his major problem has been the limited capital he has in his business as opposed to the family expenses including payment of school fees. In the photograph is Evalist (left) and the credit officer (right).

loans.use: To buy construction materials to complete his house

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru:
Ганна - вдова. Она работает поваром в школьной столовой. У нее двое детей - старшие живут отдельно, а младший с ней. Ганна трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная. Когда умер муж, поначалу было тяжело, т.к.  он выполнял всю работу по дому, но потом дети стали подрастать и помогать матери.

Ганна хочет купить материалы, чтобы сделать забор перед домом. Старый забор уже прогнил и падает. Ганна просит предоставить ей 5,000 гривень на обустройство забора в ее доме.
texts.en:
Ganna is a widow. She works as a cook in a school cafeteria. She has two children, the older one lives separately and the younger one is with her. Ganna is a hardworking and happy woman. When her husband passed away it was difficult in the beginning because he did all the work around the house, but later children grew up and began to help their mother.

Ganna wants to buy building materials to put a fence around the house. The old fence has rotted and is falling down. Ganna is asking to lend her 5,000 hryvnia to build the fence around her house.

loans.use: to put a new fence around the house.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василь – из Виноградово. Он занимается внутренними ремонтными работами, работает вместе с напарником, других рабочих в бригаде нет. Василь – не женат. Он живет с матерью, отец умер. 
Василь хочет вложить сумму в 5 000 гривен в приобретение кухни, которая стоит 5 000 гривен. Дело в том, что старая кухня в доме находится в плохом санитарном состоянии, и ее давно надо заменить. Василь мечтает о том, чтобы построить свой собственный дом.
texts.en:
Vasil is from Vinogradovo. He does repair work inside the homes and works together with a partner and there are no other workers on the team. Vasil is not married. He lives with his mother, his father passed away.

Vasil wants to invest an amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy kitchen furniture that costs 5,000 hryvnia. The kitchen at home is old and is not in a sanitary condition, it needs to be replaced a long time ago. Vasil dreams to build his own house one day.

loans.use: to purchase and install kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 45 years old. She is married and has three children aged 28, 27 and 2.  Many years ago, she established her cow raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milking cow.  In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет в Виноградово. Она работает монтером в организации под названием «Автомотив Украина». Надежда – замужем, у не трое детей. Больше всего любит отдыхать на природе. 
Надежда давно мечтала создать уют в своей кухне. Но всегда не хватало средств для того, чтобы купить необходимую кухонную мебель. В этот раз у Надежды появилась возможность воплотить свою мечту в жизнь при содействии КИВА. На сумму в 5 000 гривен она надеется приобрести кухонный гарнитур, который давно планировала установить у себя в доме.
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives in Vinogradovo. She works as a mechanic in an organization called Automotive Ukraine. Nadezhda is married and has three children. She loves to relax and be in the nature most of all.

Nadezhda has been dreaming to make her kitchen comfortable for a long time. But there were not always enough means to buy the necessary kitchen furniture. This time Nadezhda has an opportunity to make her dream come true with the help of Kiva. She hopes to use the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy kitchen furniture which she has been planning to put in her home.

loans.use: to buy kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en: Kalpana is 35 years old. She is married and has four children aged 24, 22, 17 and 14.  Many years ago, she established her goat raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy baby goats.  In the future, Kalpana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.ru:
Богдан – из Хуста. Он занимается торговлей кожаными товарами на рынках области. В этой сфере торговли работает уже 20 лет. Места на рынках арендует.  
Богдан планирует поехать в Турцию за кожаными изделиями для последующей реализации. Он надеется закупить кожаные куртки и меховые изделия, а также ремни для осенне-зимнего сезона, тем самым постепенно расширяя свой бизнес и помогая своим детям финансово за счет вырученных средств.
texts.en:
Bogdan is from Khoost. He sells leather goods on the markets of his region. He has been working in this field for over twenty years. He rents the locations on the market.

Bogdan plans to travel to Turkey to buy leather goods for reselling. He hopes to buy leather jackets and fur coats as well as belts for the autumn and winter season, and by that gradually expand his business and help his children financially using the received profit.

loans.use: to purchase leather jackets, fur coats and belts.

loans.name: Jebbeh

texts.en: Jebbeh is 45 years old and lives in Ganta, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba County. It is the second most populated county in Liberia and rich in natural resources. She is married, and her husband is a businessman; they have three children aged 5, 8, and 14 who are presently attending school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been running a shop where she sells rice and slippers. She makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a house and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase rice and slippers for her business

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 52 years old. She is married and has two children aged 35 and 30.   Many years ago, she established her grocery business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as plastic resin.

loans.name: Olena

texts.ru:
Олена работает в нескольких местах, кроме того получает пенсию. Она много помогает разным людям в жизни, оказывает социальную помощь цыганскому населению в борьбе против туберкулеза. Олена живет в собственном одноэтажном доме. Она давно хотела сделать ремонт в доме. И теперь, благодаря КИВЕ, у нее появилась эта возможность.
Олене необходима сумма в 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы улучшить условия жизни. Она планирует поштукатурить стену, установить водосточную систему под крышу, поменять входные и межкомнатные двери и одно окно, а также утеплить стены.
texts.en:
Olena works in several places and also receives a pension. She helps different people in their lives a lot, provides social help to the gypsy population in the fight against tuberculosis. Olena lives in her own one story house. She has always wanted to do remodeling in her home. Right now thanks to Kiva she has this opportunity.

Olena needs an amount of 24,000 hryvnia to improve her living conditions. She plans to plaster the wall, install a roof gutter system, to change the entrance and interior doors and one window, and also insulate the walls.

loans.use: to do some remodeling in her house.

loans.name: Asta Maya

texts.en:
Asta Maya is 60 years-old. She is married and has two children aged 25 and 24.

Many years ago, Asta Maya established her furniture making business. Working seven days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy wood and timber. In the future, Asta Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.    

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 14 and 8 years old. All three children are in school and live at home. Her husband works in the health area in Liberia. The family live in Nimba County in Liberia. Nimba is one of the most resource rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.

Roseline has operated a table business for the past four years, selling rice, sugar and oil. She works at her business for nine hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge Roseline faces in her business is not having enough goods on her table.  

With the proceeds from the loan, Roseline wants to rice, sugar and oil for her business. Roseline describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman.  She started her business with money from her her husband. She is proud of her business because she gets money every for her expense.  

In the future, Roseline wants to own a house. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil for her business.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a hardworking 38-year-old woman from Kisenyi, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. Kasifa grew up with her grandmother, because her mother and father were still in school when they gave birth to her, and her father had no source of income. All of her needs were catered for by her grandmother who was a peasant, although she could not afford school fees for her. Kasifa then dropped out of school to help her grandmother in her restaurant.

Due to the fact that she was bright, Kasifa also learnt the business and ended up starting her own restaurant. She later got a loan of 1,000,000 from Ugafode Micro finance which helped her business to grow further. This loan was repaid very well, and she is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 to complete her house.

loans.use: to complete her house.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita, de 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos que ya son mayores, por eso actualmente solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Lita se dedica a alquilar su mototaxi pero también se dedica a  la venta de calzados y prendas de vestir. LLeva alquilando su vehículo por un promedio de 8 años y durante este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas que utiliza para mejorar cada día. Trabaja sola y se siente muy cómoda haciéndolo ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar, le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene muy buenos ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, ademas se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 soles, pondrá en mantenimiento su vehículo pero para esto necesita de repuestos los cuales serán comprados con el dinero solicitado.
texts.en: 51-year-old Lita is married and she has five grown up children, but she currently only lives with two of them in her own house. Lita makes a living by hiring out her Moto taxi, but she also makes a living by selling shoes and articles of clothing. She has been hiring out her vehicle for about eight years and during this time she has learnt many things which she uses to improve every day. She works by herself and she feels very comfortable doing so since it allows her to have time with her children and she doesn’t have to neglect the household chores. It is going very well since she has very good earnings. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead. She also promises to make her repayments on time. With the requested amount of 3000 PEN she will maintain her vehicle and buy spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts in order to maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Cindy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cindy es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Cindy pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cindy trabaja como secretaria en un centro educativo de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de archivo, redacción de documentos y otros, Cindy trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cindy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea refaccionar el piso de su hogar, ya que actualmente es solo un falso piso de concreto, de esta manera Cindy y su familia tendrán mayor bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de desarrollarse profesionalmente y ascender a una mejor posición.
texts.en:
Cindy is a 22-year-old single woman. She lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead in life; thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Cindy was able to study the technical degree in Computers and Information Technology as she wanted to. In her free time she likes to do sport and she sometimes cooks a delicious Ají de Gallina to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Cindy works as a secretary in an educational centre in her city. She does archival work, produces documents, and other things. Cindy works every day from early in the morning for approximately ten hours. She feels happy doing her work and thinks it is going well for her because she does her work well and because she is nice to the others.

Cindy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to make improvements to her home. She wishes to repair the floor of her home, as currently it is only a fake concrete floor. In this way, Cindy and her family will be better off and Cindy will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of professional development and getting a better position.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Jenics

texts.en:
Jenics is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is unmarried and has four children, between the ages of 12 and 24. She describes herself as hard-working businesswoman.

Jenics lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote d’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. The county also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Since 2004, Jenics has had a table at the local market, where she sells vita, soap, salt, etc. She works 10 hour days at her business and her greatest challenge is having only a limited number of goods on her table. 

Jenics intends to use the loan to buy more vita, soap, salt, etc. for her business. She started her business with money from her brother and likes it because it keeps her busy. Jenics' plan is to become an international businesswoman. 

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more vita, soap, salt, etc for her business.

loans.name: Kihika

texts.en:
Kihika is 40-years-old, married and has five children, who all attend school. He operates a small hardware business in Kagadi and earns money to look after the family and to pay tuition. 

Kihika has been operating this business for the last five years. He previously received a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Ugafode. Kihika says this loan helped him increase his capital base and to increase his earnings.

Kihika now wants another loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more stock for his business and be in position to increase his earnings. His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport material to the business.

The major challenge to Kihika's business is the limited capital and the need to withdraw money to pay tuition for his children. Kihika is appreciative of the services from Ugafode and would like the lenders to keep supporting him financially so that his dream comes true. 

In the photo is the client (left) and credit officer (right) in the hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy hardware stock for sale.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved African masks and sculptures. Abdul hopes to stock up on wood, metal plate, polish and paint to continue production.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"When I was four, my parents divorced and I was sent to Accra. I initially stayed with an uncle, however there were times when he couldn't afford school tuition and I had to stay home. One morning, while walking aimlessly, a man called out to me and asked me to buy him food and some wood sanding discs. When I returned, he wanted to pay for my services. I politely and humbly declined but on his insistence, I accepted a plate of cooked rice and beans. His show of love and appreciation endeared him to me, to the extent that I became his errand boy. With time, a friendship developed and I became fascinated with his craft... he was a wood carver. He trained me well and eventually I became a carver in my own right."

"I thank God for bringing Novica to Ghana, and may God bless the people who are funding my microcredit. It is really helping me to produce more and thus earn more money to pay my children's school fees. My heartfelt thanks to you all."

Use the link to view Abdul's hand-carved African masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3754

loans.use: to stock up on wood, metal plates, polish and paint to continue production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in carvings and authentic African masks. He would like to purchase wood, metal plates, polish and paint to continue production.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"After completing a course in auto mechanics, getting a job was difficult and neither my parents nor I could afford the high cost of the machinery I would need to set up on my own. I struggled by doing menial jobs, but I managed to save what I could until I had enough money to buy a small piece of land and raise a wooden store. I started buying finished carvings, and in the evenings I learned to carve these beautiful items. My inspiration comes through dreams, so when I wake up I immediately put the design on paper in order not to lose the idea."

"I will forever be grateful to the people who have helped to fund my loans for me. Your generous assistance is really making me feel responsible and respected by my family, because I am able to take care of their school fees due to the sales I make through Novica. The microcredit will help me produce more designs to sell."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/1536

loans.use: to purchase wood, metal plates, polish and paint to continue production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is married and has eight children, aged between one and 25 years. Seven of her children are in school and live at home. Beatrice describes herself as good businesswoman.

Beatrice lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote d’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. The county also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

For the past six years, Beatrice has operated a table business which sells salt, sugar, pepper, oil, etc. She works 10 hours a day at her business. Beatrice's greatest challenge is to get transport to deliver goods to her table business. 

Beatrice intends to use the loan to buy more salt, sugar, pepper, oil, etc. She started her business with money from her husband, and learned this way of selling from her older sister. Beatrice likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day to build a house and educate her all her children.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, pepper, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Al-Ahdal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ahdal, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

The group has applied for a loan of 100,000 Yemeni Riel from AMB. 

Wadad is 43-years-old and married. She has been working as a vendor and has been selling food. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in this month (Ramadan). 

Wadad would like to spend her time selling more products in order to increase her profit and raise her children well. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock to sell, such as potatoes, cooking oil and flour. Wadad hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as potatoes, cooking oil, flour to sell.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
