Kwabena, who uses the artistic name K. Baka, is an artist from Ghana who specializes in paintings and batik wall hangings. He would like to invest in the purchase of dyes and cotton fabric for continued production.

Kwabena has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I specialize in paintings, craft-work, billboards, screen-printing and signboards. For my paintings, many a time I see them in dreams and visions before I actually paint them. I try to use inexpensive but high-quality material like calico, denim, military camp tents, and heavy curtain cloths. I use phone cards for the painting instead of brushes because it gives me the effect that I want."

"Thank you all for this microcredit - it makes it possible for me to continue expressing my art and making a living from it. Thank you so much."

Use the link below to view K. Baka's paintings and batik on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/840

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of dyes and cotton fabric for continued production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a Ghanaian artist who specializes in batik wall art, including paintings and wall hangings. He would like to invest in the purchase of dyes and cotton for continued production.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I majored in the arts, specializing in textiles and sculpture. I have developed my own techniques in batik production using reactive to achieve the same or better effects than would be derived in paintings. The results have been marvelous! My themes are mainly of women, beach scenes and landscapes. I try to depict the daily activities of women in Africa to support the fight for equality for the African woman."

"To me you're like angels for funding this microcredit, because now I will be able to increase my products and have more to sell."

Use the link below to view Samuel's batik wall art on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3551

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of dyes and cotton for continued production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ice creams and potatoes to increase her profit.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por  la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a su familia, Basilio no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Basilio trabaja como operario de maquinas en un tragamonedas de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad ya que antes trabajaba en el área de limpieza del mismo tragamonedas y ahora ha ascendido laboralmente.
Basilio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos médicos de uno de sus familiares que se encuentra delicado de salud, él comprará medicinas y las consultas que este necesita, de esta manera Basilio desea apoyarlo para que mejore sus dolencias, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Basilio is a 19 year old young man. He is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome problems. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to work to help his family, Basilio has not studied for a professional career. But, he would have liked to do so. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and sometimes to cook a delicious dish of rice with chicken to share with his family. 
On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Basilio works as a machinery operator in a slot machine arcade in his city. He works for about 8 hours every day. He believes he is doing well due to his responsibility as he previously worked as a cleaner in the same arcade and has risen in his job. 
Basilio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help that they offer, he can cover the medical expenses for a frail family member. He will buy medicines and the medical consultations that are needed. Basilio wants to help in this way so that the family member is supported during these ailments. He will continue working and striving to achieve he great dream to have his own house.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses for a family

loans.name: Flor De Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Flor pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Farmacia que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ayudar a su madres con sus quehaceres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Flor trabaja como técnica en una farmacia de su ciudad, ella brinda atención a los clientes vendiendo medicinas, cobrando dinero  y otros, Flor trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como ladrillos, cemento, arena y otros, los cuales utilizara para construir la parte trasera del patio de su vivienda, de esta manera Flor y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues sella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograra su gran sueño de tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Flor is a 22 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome problems. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Flor was able to study the Pharmacy Technician degree that she wanted. In her spare time she likes to help her mother around the house and sometimes to cook a delicious dish of rice and chicken to share with her family.
On her own initiative, and with much striving and dedication, Flor works as a pharmacy technician in a pharmacy in the city. She serves the customers, selling them medicine, making change, and so forth. Flor works every day from the early hours of the morning and works for about 8 hours. She enjoys her work and believes that she is doing well due to her good performance and for the friendly way that she treats others. 
Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help offered, she will be able to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, sand, and other things that she will use to build the patio and rear part of their house. In this way, Flor and her family will have greater security and wellbeing. She will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream to have her own home.

loans.use: to construct the rear portion of her home.

loans.name: Manar Group

texts.en: This group is called Manar. It consists of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 130,000 YER. Nadia is a 24-year-old single woman. She currently has a business drawing tattoos on ladies' hands. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She has worked in this business to provide her mother with income for expenses. Most of her customers are brides. She would like to expand her business so she applied for a loan from AMB. She will use the loan to increase her capital, and buy pigment(khodhab) materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: buy pigment materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the bathroom facilities for his house.

loans.name: Moatsam

texts.en:
Moatsam is a very trustworthy, responsible, and hard working vendor. He is 25 years old, and lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has been operating a business selling clothing for one month. Previously, he worked in a company where he earned a low salary. He collected money to open his business. He works very hard to improve the future for his family, and he is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to his customers. 

He has requested a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB, which he will use to buy clothes to expand his business so that he can provide his customers with a wider selection and better quality products. He hopes to open a big clothing store on a main road.

loans.use: to buy clothes to expand his business so that he can provide his customers with a wider selection and better quality products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build bathroom facilities for his home.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 32, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luz no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo con Piña para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja en su pequeña tienda bazar, ella vende chocolates, bizutería, relojes y regalos, Luz trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de vitrinas y productos diversos para regalos, de esta manera Luz podrá exhibir mejor sus productos y abastecerá su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome problems. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she had to work. she was not able to study for the business degree that she wanted. In her spare time she likes to listen to music and sometimes to cook a delicious dish of chicken with pineapple to share with her family. 
With much effort and dedication, Luz works in her little gift store. She sells chocolates, costume jewelry, watches, and gifts. Luz works every day from the early hours of the morning and works for about 8 hours. She enjoys her work and believes that she is doing well due to her good prices and the friendly way in which she treats others. 
Luz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help that they offer, she will be able to buy display cases and various products to sell for gifts. In this way, she'll be able to display her products better and stock her store. She will keep working and striving to achieve her great dream to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and display cases.

loans.name: Al-Fairoz Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fairoz and consists of three ladies: Fairoz, Arwa, and Shroq. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. 

Fairoz is the leader of this group. She lives in Aden, Yemen.  She has four children; a fifth child died, and she felt sad for the death of her child.  

She works tirelessly to provide sustenance for her family. She would like to expand her business, in addition to selling mobile recharging cards. So she applied for a loan to buy mobile recharging cards and other products to increase her sale. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for providing the first loan, and wishes to be funded for this loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharging cards and other products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works as an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) to earn a living.

She helps her husband by  providing beauty services to local community members. Marilyn offers hair cuts, hair coloring, hair relaxing and more. She has been in her business for more than two years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Marilyn joined GDMPC and she is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to improve the services provided like shampoo and conditioner, treatments, styling gel and color. She hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her beauty salon.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              to buy materials needed like hair medicine shampoo and conditioner, treatment,styling gel and color                                                                                                                                                  .

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 42-year-old woman living in Curvada, Tukuran. 

She provides for her child's needs from the small sum of 6,000 PHP she earns monthly from the palay (rice) production business she has had for more than 10 years. Her business supplements the income her husband earns from fishing and farming. 

In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a new loan of 7,500 PHP to pay for the labor costs in rice harvesting. She wants to expand her farm to be able to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for rice harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of candy.

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel, a married 24-year-old father of one, lives in the village of Camanga in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines, where he is a farmer growing rice to earn a living.

Over the past  years, he has spent much time planting, weeding and irrigating the area under the heat of the sun and on rainy days. The family's income is derived primarily from rice production, and Junel earns a total revenue of PHP 13,000 a month. 

He is now requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs. 

Junel became a member of GDMPC in 2011. He hopes to earn large returns from this investment in his rice production. He plans to work on additional farm fields to increase family income, and he hopes for another loan from the cooperative after a full repayment of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Joyrin

texts.en:
Joyrin, aged 24, is a married entrepreneur with two children from Mitugas, Tudela, who earns his income from his motorcycle transport business. He started his business more than four years ago and he earns about 6,000 PHP a month. 

 Aside from doing this, he also manages a banana farm, harvesting bananas to sell. It is the family's main source of income. 

To buy fertilizer and cover the labor costs of weeding maintenance, Joyrin borrowed 10,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC micro credit, which he joined in 2012. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover the labor costs of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Taciana is 60 years old and has one child who is in school.

Taciana has a vegetable and spice vending business in the Philippines. Taciana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell to her customers.

Taciana has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Taciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edulia

texts.en:
Edulia is 66 years old and married with eight children. Edulia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Edulia has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, sugar, soft drinks, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Edulia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 64 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a general store business in the Philippines. Ester has been in this business for 9 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.  In the future, Ester would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, aged 42 and married, is blessed with one child who is in school. She manages five hectares of rice farming which she has engaged for seven years. Vanna is not in her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as this is her third loan. The past loans, which she has repaid back completely, have enabled her to promptly support her business. Now, she is taking out a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay plowing fees. She hopes to gain high income so she can save some money for her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 55 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years and she's earning a net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase beverages, condiments, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, condiments, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married to a carpenter and lives in Sto. Noño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She has four adult children. 

She helps her husband to augment their living by providing tricycle transport and rental in the community. She has been doing this for 12 years, earning enough for their basic needs. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy a new set of tires for her tricycle. She hopes to have better living conditions in the near future and to be able to acquire another tricycle for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tricycle tires.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sughra's Group

texts.en:
Sughra is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Sughra, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing it. This will help him to continue his business. Sughra is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eva Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products. Eva Marie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Eva Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ebel

texts.en:
Ebel is starting a retail company based in Los Angeles, California. The company will design and manufacture the Reggaeton clothing brand and various accessory products. The clothing line reflects the hottest and trendiest new musical phenomena Reggaeton (R) Lifestyle, a blend of reggae and rap. The clothing retail hopes to expand this trend through its store. Ebel is looking for a microloan to fund its clothing inventory. 

Ebel's narrative on his background:
"I was born to hard working parents, my father a mechanic and mother, a seamstress. The family migrated to Los Angeles, California, in the early 80's. In the US, my father continued to work as a mechanic. My mother opened her start up apparel manufacturer as a sub-contractor, doing work to various brands. 

In late 1990, I was exposed to a brand new genre of music named Reggaeton (a mixture of tropical beats with rap lyrics).  I noticed that this music united Hispanics from different countries together. No other music genre had done [this] before. I envisioned a brand which caters to Americans of Latin American decents and Latin worldwide. Since, I am a proud owner of the trademarked Dog log and the registered Reggaeton® brand. I have established connections in the music industry that I [hope will be] extremely helpful to market my brand. I have a strong following from young millenniums. I hope to see my apparel designs in major retail stores across the United States and the world. We are the brand of the future."

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, vegetables and spices.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Glenda dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina is 49-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Safina, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Safina is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children. 

She lives in Tukuran, where she has earned a living for years by selling home and used products. She makes PHP 4,000 a month from her business. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008 and is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She hopes in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married with one child and lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

She owns and manages a general store selling grocery items while her husband buys and sells cassava. For more than six years, they have been doing such things to earn a living. 

Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and is requesting a loan to buy more grocery items like canned goods, noodles, milk and sugar. A portion from this loan will be used to buy more cassava for sale. She hopes to improve the business and their general living situation as well.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like canned goods, noodles, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 71 years old and widowed with five children.

Clemencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like shampoo, milk, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her general store.

Clemencia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Clemencia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like shampoo, milk, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Glezel

texts.en:
Glezel is 37 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Glezel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in a pig fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Glezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman continues her loan to increase the pig business. The advantage of the business is to pay school fees.
 
With full support from her husband, Ni Nyoman is using her loan to purchase three local piglets for pigroll. Because the price for feed is quite high, Ni Nyoman will feed the piglets with mixture feed to reduce the cost. 

Three of the members have resigned from the group. They must move to another village to follow their husbands, who work there. But they promise to continue the business there and give information about the program in their new place. The group also has one new member.

loans.use: To purchase three local piglets for pigroll.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 54-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and eight children. She wants to take out a loan to support her elder son; her son has been doing a job as a salesman since 2008. His daily practice was to take inventory items such as Rusks, cakes, cookies, 'bubbles', chocolates, etc., from wholesalers and deliver them to retailers on a  bike. One year ago he got into a road accident with his bike and his one leg was fractured. Temporarily he is doing a job as an accountant in a pizza company but getting a very low salary. Now, his injury has approximately recovered and he wants to start his salesman business again but he does not have savings.

Nasreen requested a loan so that her son could start up his salesman business again. She hopes that her son will easily establish his business again and contribute to household expenses as he did earlier.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy Rusks, cakes, cookies, 'bubbles', chocolates, etc. for goods distribution business.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one little child and in her late 20s, Channa is a resident of Bovel district of Battambang province. To cover the daily cost of living, she plants rice and corn on three hectares of farmland. This business has returned her about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Channa is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has now formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed, and to pay the corn-reaping fee. She hopes to make more income so that she can send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed, and to pay corn-reaping fee

loans.name: Kimyin

texts.en: Kimyin is 37 years old and married. She has two dependent children to care for as they are still in school. For her, four hectares of rice farming, with which she has been involved for 10 years, is the main source of income. This is the fifth loan for Kimyin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her loan completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle to better than before. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for labor costs for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a higher yield from her crop and make more income.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for her farmland

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a fishing / fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beauty products. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 61 years old and married with three children. Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, cooking oil, spices, salt and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, spices, salt and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, cooking oil, spices, salt and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luzsviminda

texts.en: Luzsviminda is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a dress making business in the Philippines for 5 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her dress making business. Luzsviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her dress making business.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng is 33 years old and a widow with one dependent child. She strives to earn a living via a grocery selling business, which she has been involved in for five years. It has returned her about 36,100 KHR per day. 

Korng is the a time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy more grocery items to support her business. She hopes to replenish her grocery items on time and make a good profit for her family.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Chhong's Group

texts.en:
A 29-year-old mother of three little children residing in Battambang province, Chhong is a farmer who does rice farming on one and half hectares as her primary source of income. She also can make additional income via working for other for a fee. Involved in her current business for two years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Chhong is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans and used them wisely to improve her livelihood to better than before. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and herbicide for her farmland. She hopes to earn a high income from her current business for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and herbicide for her farmland

loans.name: Sreyven's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province in her early 30s, Sreyven is married and has to take care of her two dependent children. For the entire household, one hectare of rice farming is the main source of income. Her husband also helps her to support the family via working at construction sites. The business, which she has had for 12 years, has returned her about 24,200 KHR per day. 

Sreyven and her joint borrower are new clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This cycle, both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Sreyven, the leader, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to promptly support her business and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase bangles for bangle-selling business

loans.name: Gloria Estefany

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Gloria pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de pedagogía inicial que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gloria trabaja en un colegio inicial como maestra, ella enseña a niños pequeños entre 3 a 5 años, Gloria trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su paciencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Gloria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales pedagógicos, como libros, cubos, rompecabezas y otros, de esta manera Gloria podrá utilizar mejores métodos para enseñarles a sus alumnos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio centro educativo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 20, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the Jayanca District of Piura. She is a very kind, hard working, and enthusiastic person who dreams of success. Gloria's efforts and her parents' support allowed her to pursue her ambition to study early childhood education. In her spare time, Gloria enjoys listening to music and occasionally preparing a rich Arroz Chaufa [a Peruvian-Chinese style rice dish] to share with her family. 

Gloria works in a preschool, teaching children ages three to five. She works up to ten hours each day, giving her students her dedication and determination from early morning into the afternoon. Gloria enjoys her work and believes that her patience and kindness for others makes her an effective teacher. 

Gloria is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that will allow her to purchase educational materials including books, cubes, puzzles, and others. These materials will allow Gloria to employ better methods for teaching her students, become a better teacher, and realize her dream of running her own educational center.

loans.use: to purchase educational materials.

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
Noeurn is 57 years old and married. She and her family reside in Kampong Cham province where her farming business is run. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. For her family, growing rice on one hectare area and working for others for a fee are the main sources of income.  

Engaged in her current business for 37 years, she is able to earn up to 25,700 KHR per day. This is the first micro loan for Noeurn’s group consisting of three female members. Noeurn is the leader and will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She firmly believes that she can get a high yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 24, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For the sake of her family, she counts on her rice farming during the rainy season and dry season. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. This is the second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Mao. She has fully repaid back her past loan, which has helped her support her lifestyle better than before. For this new cycle, she is seeking 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase her crop yield better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 31-years old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a daughter; her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Lubna owns a small business selling ladies ready-made garments at home. She purchases ready-made garments from the market at low prices and sells them at a high price. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot and demand more variety because the Eid festival is about to come. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings, so they can save all of Lubna's earnings. 

She requested a loan so that she can buy a greater variety of garments to fulfill customer demand. 

Lubna wishes for the bright future of her daughter and her dream is to provide a better education to her daughter.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with three children. She lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Helen's husband is a fisherman and she helps him to generate income by making fruit salad to sell at the school canteen and to individuals. She has been in this business for many years. 

Helen is requesting a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy raw ingredients to make fruit salad. She hopes to expand her business and improve the general living condition of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make fruit salad

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en:
Carmelito is 33 years old and married with three children. He is from Tonggo, Tudela. For the past four years, Carmelito has been running a gardening business. He earns 3,200 PHP a month and joined GDMPC in 2012.

Carmelito is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is 53 years old and has a live-in partner with eight children. With two children currently in school, Jovencia works very hard to provide for them.

Jovencia runs a dried fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell. She has been in this business for two years. 

Jovencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 46 years old and has two children. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past years of her married life, Mildred has been selling seafood in the marketplace. She deals with different people well and maintains good relationships with her fellow vendors and, most importantly, her customers. Mildred's family has other sources of income but selling seafood is the main cash provider for the family. She is a member of GDMPC and has received and repaid several previous loans from the organization.

Mildred is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to acquire additional seafood products to sell. Her loan will improve her ability to engage in her business. As time goes by, Mildred aims to sustain and expand her business to increase her sales.

loans.use: to acquire seafood products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy energy saver bulbs

loans.name: Musrat's Group

texts.en:
Musrat is a 49-year-old married women who is a mother with four sons. Her husband is government employee.  Musrat has started a clothing business and she purchases a variety of clothing from different areas to sell at a profitable price in the main market. She wants to support her family through her business but lacks financing.  

Musrat is requesting a loan to purchase some clothing to sell. She is a member of a two-person loan group requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Musrat is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
Poh Gending Lestari group, located in rural areas mostly, have farming businesses and raise livestock. One business is raising pigs. With the number of group members at 10, the group got a loan of 25,000,000 IDR. 

Ni Nengah, head of the group, tries to keep different types of pig. She already has a sow. She's using the loan to buy three types of local pigs which will be sold for pigroll (barbeque). Pigs will be maintained for two months, then sold again. Profits from the sale will be set aside for savings and used to buy more pigs again. Ni Nengah hopes this effort will be smooth so that she will be able to realize her dream to make her kitchen more spacious.

loans.use: To buy three types of local pig

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 31 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is taxi driver.

Gulnaz started her tailoring business five years back. She is very hard-working lady. She wants to support her family through her business. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her business. She will use the loan amount to purchase tailoring material for her work like thread, cloth, and machine oil. This will help her to work more efficiently. The income she earn through her business plays an important role for her family as her husband's income is insufficient to cover the household needs. She hopes that the requested loan will be helpful for her work. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cloth, and machine oil

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 44, is married and a mother of one schoolchild. She strives to earn a living from a half hectare of rice crops, two hectares of cassava, and from selling grocery items.  She has been involved in her current business since she was 24 years old and it has returned her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Yat has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a microloan group consisting of five female members.  The total amount of her group loan is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 200,000 KHR is her loan portion. Yat will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her two cash-crops. She hopes to gain a higher yield from her business and make more income to expand her grocery-selling business.

loans.use: To buy potash for her two cash-crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 62 years old, married, and a father of two. He is a nurse who offers mobile medical services in Kilifi, Kenya. Benjamin has been in this business for the last 25 years and has done well. His wife provides additional income for the family. 

Benjamin is requesting a loan from KADET Ltd to purchase clinical equipment, disinfectants, cotton, and bandages. This will be his second loan. Benjamin will use his anticipated profit to repay his loan. In the future, he hopes to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: to purchase clinical equipment, disinfectants, cotton, and bandages

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man, 48 years old. He is married to Keremenjia Bochaberi and he supports five people in his family. He has been in this business for 25 years and his monthly income is KES 8000.He has borrowed a second loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 10,000 in which he will use to purchase more textiles. His hope and dream is to live well and educate  his children.

loans.use: To purchase more textile materials

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now and she works hard to support her family. 

Cecilia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional textiles, threads, and other items for her business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy textiles, threads, and other items for her business

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a 54-year-old cereals trader and grinding machine owner in Voi, Kenya. She is married to a retired teacher who provides additional income from his pension, and together they support six children who are all adults. She has been in this business for the last twenty years and has done great. 

This marks her fifth time borrowing to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase cereals for grinding into flour before selling to her clients and use the anticipated profit to service her loan. She hopes open a second shop for one her children to run in future.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for her grinding machine

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina is 47 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Larina works very hard to provide for them.

Larina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Larina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Larina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 41 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to their lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Samina is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair their rickshaw.

loans.name: Lester Efre

texts.es: El Sr Lester Efren comenzó con su negocio desde hace 2 años vendiendo ropa usada visitando,a familiares y  amigos ,mostrandole lo que tenia, hasta que decidí comprar pacas mixtas y poner el negocio en mi casa con ayuda de mi esposa ,ella se quedaba en la venta y yo salia a ofrecer y con mucha refuerzo surtí el negocio y estoy saliendo adelante ...
texts.en: Lester Efren began his business two years ago selling used clothing, visiting his family and friends displaying his stock, until he decided to buy mixed bales and to establish a home based business with the help of his wife. “She stays at home selling and I go out boosting sales. I am provisioning the business and moving forward.”

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Juan pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Veterinaria que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja en su veterinaria, el atiende mascotas, aves y animales de granja, Juan trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales quirúrgicos para operaciones de animales, adicionalmente Juan comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar la fachada de su veterinaria,  de esta manera el espera mejorar su servicio y desea atender a mas pacientes,así pues Juan seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran veterinaria.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 years old and single. He lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed. Thanks to his own efforts and the support of his parents Juan was able to study to be a veterinarian, which is what he wanted. He likes to play sports in his spare time and sometimes cooks a tasty seafood rice dish to share with his family. 

With much determination and dedication Juan works as a veterinarian, caring for pets, birds and farm animals. Juan works every day from the early hours of the morning, up to 12 hours per day. He is happy doing this work and feels that things are going well due to the friendly way he treats others. 

Juan is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their support he can buy surgical supplies to treat animals. Also Juan will buy construction materials to fix the front of his animal hospital. By doing this he can offer better service and take care of more patients. He can continue to work and strive to fulfill his dream of having a large veterinary practice.

loans.use: to buy surgical and construction materials.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito has been managing his farming business for 10 years now, a skill he acquired from his father, who is also a farmer. Through the business he is able to support the daily needs of his family.

Because he needs to improve his yield, Charito is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers. He dreams of increasing his income so he can better his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver, a married mother of four children, two of whom go to school, also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Oliver sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. In business for the last 12 years, she works seven days a week. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She has requested a loan of shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es soltera, tiene un hijo que esta en colegio, vive en una casa en alquiler ocupando dos habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como administradora por mas de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada, y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación,educación,alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
Cecilia necesita crédito para comprar una computadora ya que le sera de mucha ayuda a ella y a su hijo en sus estudios.
El sueño de Cecilia es tener su casa propia para brindarle comodidad y seguridad a su hijo,también desea tener su  propio negocio de cocina ya que ella tambien se dedica a la cocina
texts.en:
Cecilia is single. She has a son in college. She rents two rooms of a house that is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she works as an administrator for more than eight hours a day in a private business, and the earnings help cover the expenses of food, education, rent and utilities. 

Cecilia needs a loan in order to buy a computer as it would be a big help to her and her son in his studies.

Cecilia’s dream is to have her own home in order to provide comfort and security to her son. She would also like to have her own culinary business as she likes to cook too.

loans.use: to buy a computer which will help her and her college age son in his studies

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a 48-year-old woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yam, and taamu (a root vegetable grown in Samoa) to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy a mist blower, chemicals, rolls of fencing wire, bush knives, an axe, a planting tool, knife sharpeners, and nails.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Pelenatete hopes to reinvest her profits into her business and assist in her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy a mist blower, chemicals, rolls of fencing wire, bush knives, an axe, a planting tool, knife sharpeners, and nails

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia trabaja como portera y ademas vende comida los fines de semana, su educación sólo llega hasta nivel de secundaria. Vive en la ciudad de la Paz.

Marcia trabaja mas de 12 horas al dia para cubrir gastos de agua, luz y educacion  ya que es una persona independiente.

Necesita crédito para compra de insumos para su negocio de comida como picantes, maní y otros comestibles.
texts.en: Marcia works as a janitor and also sells food on the weekends. She only studied up to secondary school. She lives in the city of La Paz. Marcia works 12 hours a day or more in order to pay for water, light  and education as she is an independent person. She needs this loan to buy supplies for her food business such as peanuts, chilies, and other foods.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania Es comerciante de abarrotes en un mercado, apenas pudo terminar la secundaria. Vive en la ciudad de La Paz.

Tania trabaja en su puesto más de 12 horas al dia, necesita cubrir sus gastos de manutención.

Necesita crédito para incrementar su mercadería, se ha dado cuenta que necesita ser más competitiva para vender arroz, azucar, conservas y otros para mejorar su ingresos.
texts.en:
Tania is a grocery merchant in a market. She barely finished her secondary school studies. She lives in the city of La Paz.

Tania works in her stand more than 12 hours a day. She needs to cover her living expenses.

She needs a loan in order to increase her merchandise as she has realized she needs to be more competitive selling rice, sugar, canned foods, and other items in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El Sr. José Manúel es originario de la cd. de Piedras Negras, lugar en el que ha vivido por 64 años, prácticamente toda su vida, es un hombre casado, sus hijos son mayores y ya tienen su propia familia, solo le queda un hijo soltero pero vive solo, y el Sr. José Manúel  vive con su esposa, trabajo de maestro en diferentes instituciones educativas durante muchos años, ahora ya es pensionado y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que tiene en su mismo domicilio, de igual manera vende terrenos que tiene a las afueras de Piedras Negras.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para comprar más mercancía para su negocio, el cual atiende él junto con su esposa, para así incrementar un poco más las ventas y generar más ingreso para que un futuro poderla hacer más grande, ampliar el lugar donde tiene la tienda de la venta de abarrotes y así dejarsela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Manúel is originally from the city of Piedras Negras, where he has lived for 64 years, practically his entire life. He is married and his sons are adults and have their own families. He only has one single son who lives alone. José Manúel lives with his wife and had a job as a teacher in different educational institutions for many years. Now he is retired and makes a living selling groceries, a business he has in his own home. He also sells land which he owns outside of Piedras Negras.

He asks for help through Kiva to buy more merchandise for his business, which he attends together with his spouse. He hopes to increase his sales a little more and to generate more income so that in the future he can expand the business, enlarge the space where he has the grocery store, and then leave the business to his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 38-year-old man, married to Judy, and a father of two children. He practices dairy and poultry farming and also does crop farming. He has been in this business for six years. He gets a monthly income of 42,000 shillings.

This will be Francis's sixth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy seven bags of poultry feed. He hopes to start a commercial dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy seven bags of poultry feed

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra, age 48, is a housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Bushra is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Bushra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 32 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Lydia has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia es originaria de la cd. de Candela, Coah. tiene 46 años de edad, de los cuales 30 años ha vivido en la cd. de Piedras Negras y donde actualmente radica, es madre de dos hijos, todas las mañanas se despierta temprano para ir a su trabajo donde se dedica a la reestructuración de créditos, lugar en donde  tiene 3 años laborando en esa empresa, para que las personas que dejaron de pagar sus viviendas de interés social no las pierdan, sino al contrario las recuperen, de esta forma apoya a mucha gente, las personas que la conocen comentan que es muy amable y que siempre hace todo lo posible por ayudar a las personas por igual.
Pide apoyo a través de KIVA para poder ampliar su casa ya que actualmente es pequeña y como sus hijos están creciendo quisiera que cada uno tuviera su propia recmara y cada uno tenga su propio espacio, para así se sienten comódos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia is from the Candela neighborhood in Coah.  Sonia, age 46, has lived in the Piedras Negras neighborhood for 30 years, and she still lives there.  She has two children.

She gets up early every morning in order to go to work at the company where she has been working for three years.  She restructures loans for people living in government subsidized housing and have stopped paying.  She does this so that that instead of losing their houses they are able to take them back.  In this way she helps a lot of people.  The people who know her say that she is very kind, and that she always does everything possible to help people equally.

She is asking for support through Kiva in order to be able to expand her house.  It is now small, and as her children are growing, she would like each one to have their own bedroom and for each one to have their own space.  Then they will feel comfortable in their home.

loans.use: to expand her house.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn is a citizen from Battambang province. She has three dependent children, two schoolchildren and one younger kid. Her main source of income is from maize farming, which she has done for 12 years. It has returned her about 20,700 KHR per day. Vorn is the first time borrower with VisonFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking a new loan to pay for labor costs and buy corn seeds for her agribusiness. Besides those, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to replenish her business. She hopes to make more income and improve her family’s living condition better than before.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy corn seeds for her agribusiness

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 31-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a clothing shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of clothes in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him increase his net income as well as his savings. However, due to a lack of funds, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase clothes from factories and sell them in the market, at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sumaira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores , de 48 años de edad, esta casada con Dionisio y vive junto a sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene como principal actividad económica la agricultura siendo propietaria de un terreno de 2 hectáreas de cultivo donde posee alguno de los productos más rentables de la zona como cacao, café, achiote y árboles frutales.
Se inició desde muy joven con ayuda de su esposo con quien inicialmente compró media hectárea de terreno para luego comprar los restantes. Diariamente se dirige a sus terrenos en donde con ayuda de su esposo y jornaleros del lugar realizan actividades manteniendo las plantaciones de sus parcelas en buen estado hasta la temporada de cosecha.Para mejorar la calidad de sus terrenos de cultivo suele usar abono orgánico. Tiene en mente realizar una mejora a su vivienda como es la construcción de columnas con cemento para fortalecer la construcción de su casa. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento y contratar a una persona que se encargue de reemplazar las columnas de madera por vigas de cemento.
texts.en:
Dolores, 48 years old, is married to Dionisio and they live with their children in their own house. Her principal economic activity is agriculture. She is proprietor of a 2 hectare parcel producing some of the more profitable products of the zone such as cacao, coffee, annatto, and fruit trees.

Dolores began farming when she was very young with the help of her husband who initially purchased half a hectare of land and later bought the rest. Daily, she goes to the fields where she helps her husband and laborers from the area perform maintenance activities to keep the plantings in good condition until harvest season. To improve the quality of her cultivated lands she uses only organic manure.

Dolores wants to improve her house by constructing cement columns to strengthen it's construction.

This is her 1st Kiva loan and she is grateful for this financial help which will allow her to forge ahead. Moreover, she is committed to making her payments in a punctual manner. On this occasion, she requests 1,000 new sols to purchase cement and to contract a person to take charge of replacing the wooden columns with cement ones.

loans.use: to buy cement and hire a laborer to strengthen her house.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 46 años, esta casada con Hipólito y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Claudia se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cacao orgánico, café, achiote y barbasco junto a su esposo y con ayuda de sus hijos en actividades menores. Comenta que optó por esta labor cuando sus padres le cedieron un terreno cuando tuvo a su primer hijo y no tenía un oficio fijo para el sostén de su familia. Con el paso de los años y el trabajo que realizaba logró comprar otro terreno de una hectárea donde amplió su producción de cacao y barbasco esperando mejorar sus ingresos, siendo este una buena inversión que planeó. Todos los días debe dirigirse a sus terrenos desde muy temprano junto a su esposo para realizar un mantenimiento a sus plantaciones con la intención de obtener una buena calidad en los frutos. Durante los años que viene trabajando en el campo así como buenos momentos que vive como parte de su rutina diaria también ha tenido malas experiencias siendo una de ellas el fracaso de una campaña de cultivo por las plagas que aprendió a combatir con la ayuda de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles parla compra de herramientas como machetes, tijeras de podar, serruchos de podar entre otros para renovar las que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Claudia is 46 years old. She is married to Hipólito and has 2 children who live in their own home. 

Claudia works in agriculture growing organic cocoa, coffee, annattos, and mullein. Her husband helps her along with the children in minor duties. She says that she opted for this work when her parents gave her some land when she had her first child and she had no fixed way to support her family.

With the passing of time and through her work she was able to buy another hectare plot of land where she expanded her cocoa and mullein production hoping to improve her income, feeling this would be a good planned investment.

Every day from very early she goes to the field with her husband to maintain their farm with the intention of harvesting good quality fruit. During the years that she has been working in the field she has had some good times as it is a part of the daily routine, and she has also had some bad experiences one of them being the damage of a crop due to pests which she learned to fight with the help of her family.

This is her first loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help she is receiving so she can get ahead and she agrees to make her payments on time.

At this time she is asking for 500 soles in order to buy tools like machetes, pruning shears, and handsaws, among other items in order to renew the supplies she already has.

loans.use: to buy tools such as machetes, pruning shears, and handsaws

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for a groocery-selling business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a buy-and-sell, dry goods business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Maria has been in this business for 15 years now.

Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita engages in hog raising in her town. She has been involved in this kind of business for 15 years. Income earned in the business is used to meet her family's needs and pay the education expenses of her two children. She also maintains farming and transport service businesses with the help of her husband.

To maintain and improve her hog-raising business, Melita asks for a loan of 15,000 PHP which will allow her to purchase hog feed and vitamins. This way, she can ensure the growth and nutrition of her hogs.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Belisa

texts.es: La señora Belisa tiene sesenta y tres (63) años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolivar; este municipio es considerado como el primer centro artesanal de la costa Atlántica de Colombia, además también el primer comercializador de productos elaborados en telar vertical como hamacas y su diversificación, también produce productos elaborados en croché y macramé, así como también productos de la madera, la talabartería y los instrumentos de gaita entre otros. La señora Belisa tiene 13 hijos entre las edades de 18 a 42 años, actualmente vive solo con uno de sus hijos y un nieto. Su actividad de negocio son las confecciones, aprendió esta actividad desde muy joven, observando a su mamá, ya que es un oficio de tradición familiar; y con el cual pudo sostener y criar a todos sus hijos.  Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de telas e insumos para la elaboración de vestidos, y también para el arreglo del piso de la casa. Una de sus metas es la de acondicionar mejor su taller, y seguir mejorando su vivienda. Tiene una liquidez corriente de 1.7, capital de trabajo $547.500, y capacidad de pago de $131.600.
texts.en:
Belisa is sixty-three (63) years old. She lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, in the Bolivar department. This area is considered to be the first craft center on Colombia’s Atlantic coast. It also was the first to sell products made on vertical looms such as hammocks and similar items. The city also produces works of crochet and macramé, as well as wood products, leather products, flutes, and more. Belisa has 13 children between the ages of 18 and 42 years. Currently she lives with one of her sons and a grandson.

Her business activity is sewing. She learned this activity when she was very young by watching her mother, as it was a family tradition, and one with which she could bring up her children.

This is her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy fabric and supplies to make clothing and also to fix the floor of the house.

One of her goals is fix up her workshop and to continue improving her home. She has a current ratio of 1.7, working capital of $547.500 COP and the ability to pay $131.600 COP.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies in order to make clothing and also to fix the floor of the house.

loans.name: Sovanratana's Group

texts.en:
Sovanratana is a 27-year-old mother of two little kids. She and her family are residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

For her kids’ sake, Sovanratana plants pineapples as her core business to earn income. She has been involved in her current business for seven years, and it has returned her about 27,200 KHR per day. 

Sovanratana and the other two fellow-group members are in their third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her loan with success, and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, Sovanratana will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to gain a double yield with a good income for her family.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is a 40-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a taxi business which has been in operation for two years. Tumema needs a loan to pay for vehicle maintenance such as new tires, oil, gas, and timber for her taxi. She will also use the loan to pay her children's school fees and to purchase iron roofing to renovate her house. She plans to utilize her profits well by reinvesting them in her taxi and using them to improve her family's living standards. In 2012, Tumema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance including new tires, oil, gas, and timber for her taxi.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафар 30-летний женатый человек, проживающий со своей семьей в городе Вахдат. Он недавно вернулся с России, где он работал мигрантом в течение года. Перед отъездом Музафар передал свой торговый бизнес своему брату, чтобы он в его отсутствии продолжил их семейный бизнес. Однако когда Музафар вернулся на родину, он узнал, что его брат обанкротился и весь его бизнес сгорел. В настоящее время он хочет заново начать свой бизнес. Он уже испытал на себе трудную жизнь мигранта и не собирается больше покидать родину. У Музафара имеется торговая точка на рынке от прошлого бизнеса, а также сбережение в размере 3000 TJS, заработанные им в России. 
Чтобы купить товар Музафар обратился за кредитом. Он снова собирается торговать мужской одеждой. Музафар на сумму кредита и своего сбережения хочет купить ассортимент мужских футболок и брюков и приступить к деятельности. Сейчас он нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Muzafar is a 30-year-old married man who lives with his family in the city of Vakhdat.  Not long ago he returned to Russia, where he worked as a migrant laborer for a year.  Before his departure, Muzafar gave his trading business to his brother so he would continue the family business in Muzafar's absence.  But when Muzafar returned home, he found out that his brother had gone bankrupt and the whole business had burned down.  Now he wants to start the business back up again.  He has already lived the hard life of a migrant worker and he doesn't plan to leave his home again.  Muzafar has a trading stall in the market from his last business, and he has savings in the amount of 3,000 TJS from his earnings in Russia.  He has asked for a loan so he can buy his goods.  He plans to sell men's clothing again.  With the loan and his savings, he wants to buy an assortment of men's t-shirts and pants and get to work.  He is in need of support.

loans.use: to buy in-season men's clothing to restart his business.

loans.name: Ruta Christina

texts.en:
Ruta Christina is 27 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice-cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, some flavoured cordial, and a cooler. 

In the future, Ruta hopes to expand her business in selling other similar goods. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, some flavours, and a cooler.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 27 years old and married with two children, two of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, detergent soap, noodles, cream, etc. 

Gina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like candies, snack foods, detergent soap, noodles, cream, etc. to sell in her general store.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like candies, snack foods, detergent soap, noodles, cream, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 29-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a decoration shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells different decoration items for various occasions. 

Presently, Shazia’s husband is interested to offer more variety to his customers. This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Shazia, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. In this way, she can help her husband to purchase a variety of decoration items to sell at a profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of decoration products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 33 years old, is married, and has been blessed with four children. She is thankful because, through her perseverance and initiative, she has been able to earn greater profits. She manages a business manufacturing salted eggs (red eggs) and selling "balut." She has been involved in this type of business for 13 years. According to Genalyn, the income from this business has been used for the family's daily food consumption, allowances for her children in school, and other household expenditures.
