Genalyn aspires to the continuous growth of her food-manufacturing business. She is requesting financial support in the amount of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she will use to buy fresh eggs in bulk so she can supply all her customers and improve the taste of her products. Her dream is to become successful in her chosen business and for the product she manufactures to become popular and profitable at an affordable price.

loans.use: buy fresh eggs in bulk

loans.name: Telisa

texts.en: Telisa is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling elei lavalava (sarongs) in her community. To do so, she needs a loan to buy materials such as brushes, elei board, fabric paint, rolls of fabric, and buckets. In the future, Telisa hopes to expand her business. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials for making elei lavalava, such as brushes, elei board, fabric paint, rolls of fabric, and buckets.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Silvestra works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Silvestra is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her business.

Silvestra has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 33 year old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of  three children. 

Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of vegetables in his shop. Presently he is interesed in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of cash for expenses, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Rukhsana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Inyama

texts.en:
Inyama lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Inyama is married and has two children. Both he and his wife have been farming for 25 years and are currently growing sugar cane on their land. Inyama likes beekeeping because it is an easy project that generates good income for him and his family. 

This is Inyama’s first loan, and he plans to use the proceeds to invest in projects on his farm, so as to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 60, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for her husband's business.

loans.name: Poeun's Group

texts.en:
Poeun, age 41 and a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is a mother of five children. She struggles to earn enough for her family's daily food consumption via her sole business of rice farming and pineapple growing. She has been involved in her business for ages, and through it she earns about 34,200 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

This is not Poeun's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wisely and fully repaid her past loan, which made her standard of living better than before. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group consisting of three female members. Poeun will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to have a high yield with a good profit to support her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 43 year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan of Rs.40, 000, which she will partially use for her husband’s business and partially for her son’s business. Her husband owns a fruit selling business and her son owns a cigarette shop, both equally participate in household expenses.
 
With the increase in the household expenses she wants to grow the business as well. She is the mother of 5 children, her 2 sons also work as laborers for daily wages. Her 2 daughters helps her in daily routine work.
 
She wants to save some profit so that she can arrange the marriage of both daughters.

Sajida hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and that she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruit and tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  is single with no children. She also takes care of family members. 

She operates a retail shop at the market.  She has been in business for the last four years. She gets additional income from teaching in a neighboring school. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested UGX 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of beans, cooking oil, flour and soap. Her major challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to open up a wholesale shop. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, cooking oil, flour and soap.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora would like to request for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy clippers and different kinds of nail polish for her beauty service business and other beauty kits. She knows that a loan of this amount will help her realize her dreams in life someday, so she hopes and prays that lenders will approve the loan for her.

Leonora has been in this business for 20 years. She is married and has three children. Currently, two of her children go to school while the other one is a fruits vendor. Leonora and her husband work hard in order to earn a prosperous living and to provide education to their two children.

loans.use: to buy clippers and different kinds of nail polish for her beauty service business and other beauty kits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a printing machine for her husband's screen printing business

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Analina is a married woman and has six children. Analina has been engaged in the farming business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of her income.

Analina is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm: with them, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Analina has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 33 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Sibaroc, Jimenez, with one child. 

She has been earning income from her transport service business for two years now and she earns 3,000 PHP a month. She also has a garden of vegetables which she sells in the market to gain more income.

To buy fertilizer, she is requesting a new loan of  5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit. Gata Daku MPC helps Liza to improve both her ability to engage in her business practices and her general living conditions. Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. Anastacia earns a living through her food-vending business, selling various home-cooked snack foods like "kakanin". Kakanin is made of glutinous rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Anastacia would like access to a loan to buy more ingredients for making rice cakes like glutinous rice, sugar and milk. With these ingredients, she will be able to cook more and sell more to the people in her area, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Anastacia has hopes of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making rice cakes like glutinous rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen is a father of three children and a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. His source of income is rice cropping on two hectares of land. He is able to earn extra income via a small place to fix bicycles and charge motorcycle batteries. He has been involved in his current businesses for seven years, earning about 18,900 KHR per day.

This is not the first loan for Sen with Kiva field partner, VisionFund. He has utilized his past loan wisely to expand his battery-charging business so it's better than before. Now, he is seeking a new loan to buy the necessary equipment for his bicycle repair shop. He hopes to make more income to improve his lifestyle and send all of his children to school.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en: Suriya is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two sons. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband manufactures almirah and sells them in the main market. He needs an iron sheet for manufacturing almirah but due to their lack of finances he finds it difficult. For that reason, Suriya is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase items required for his business so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Suriya hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an iron sheet for manufacturing almirah.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is married and has one child. Susanita is 53 years old, and resides in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Susanita owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

In 2007, she joined GDMPC. Susanita requested a new loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for labor costs for farm maintenance. In the future, Susanita wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for farm maintenance

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide is 32 years old, married and has four children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as water, fish, breaks, milk, noodles, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, soap, body loosen and biscuits.

She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) for offering loans to poor people. Adelaide has animals including a goat, two pigs and five chickens and also has large, extensive gardens so she crates vegetable crops, papayas, corn and so on.

loans.use: To buy water, fish, breaks, milk, noodles, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes and soap.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
A resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Arsenio is 52 years old, married, and has four children. For more than five years he has been growing and harvesting coconuts to sell at the market. He earns 6,000 PHP a month, and he also provides motor transportation services to supplement his income.

In order to increase his harvest, Arsenio is requesting a loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman, and has three children.  Catherine has been engaged in the farming business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income.

Catherine is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.   With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her  harvest.  

In the future, Catherine hopes to expand her business and make it a success.  Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Chicupense Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina es casada, cuenta con 34 años de edad, curso la primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que aun no está estudiando, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de café, inició este negocio juntamente con su esposo comprando un pequeño terreno y empezaron a sembrar café, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de café, desea en el futuro que su cultivo sea cada vez en mayor cantidad. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a elaboracion de tejidos.
 En la fotografía aparecen 9 personas, pero, solamente a 8 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina is 34 years old, married, and completed primary school. She has one son who isn't attending school yet. 

She plants and harvests coffee. She started this business with her husband by buying a small parcel of land, and they began to plant coffee. So far they have seven years of experience. She is organizing a group and requesting a loan that she will use to buy fertilizer for their coffee crop. 

In the future she wishes to grow a crop of increasingly greater quantity The other members of the group work at weaving textiles. Nine people appear in the photograph, but only eight of them were granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50 year old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interesed in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of cash for expenses, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices.

 With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruits from the field.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, breads, soft drinks, hard drinks, oil, biscuits and rice. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.  

Aida is living in a town nearby the school.  Her kiosk is located in a strategic place, where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, breads, soft drinks, hard drinks, oil, biscuits and rice.

loans.name: Doston

texts.ru: Достону 19 лет. Он родился и вырос в семье рабочих. Его мать Ёркиной работает заведующим ЗАКС их района, а отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Достон с раннего детства мечтал стать врачом. Он усердно учился в средней школе и брал дополнительные уроки для того, чтобы глубже учить такие предметы, как математика, биология, химия, физика. После окончания средней школы он не смог поступить в университет и поэтому он поступил на подготовительное отделение Медицинского Университета. Данное время он является студентом Медицинского Университета Таджикистана и должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители не имеют денег для оплаты учебного договора. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Doston is 19 years old.  He was born and raised in a family of workers.  His mother Yerkinoy works as head of the Legislative Assembly in their area, and his father a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Doston has dreamed of becoming a doctor from a young age. He studied hard in middle school and took extra classes in order to have a deeper knowledge of subjects such as mathematics, biology, chemistry, and physics. After finishing middle school, he was unable to go to university, and so he entered the preparatory department of the Medical University. Currently, he is a student at the Medical University of Tajikistan and needs to pay his tuition.  His parents did not have the money to pay for his tuition. He has requested a loan in the amount of $1100 U.S. dollars to pay for his tuition. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
ASHA, who is in her mid 50's, is a widow with seven children, of whom only four are in school. Three of the children are adults, and depend on themselves.

For twenty years now, ASHA has been running her life by managing a butcher business selling meats. She is doing fine with her project, and it shows. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and is able to make a very good profit per month. 

This is her 16th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought more butcher meat and opened a grocery business, which is run by her daughters. With the profit received, she covered school fees and home expenses, built a house and reinvested in the business.  The remaining amount she decided to save for her future. 

ASHA will use this loan to buy a butcher cow and more grocery store drinks to resell. She dreams of owning a nice, private car. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Serena," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a butcher cow and more grocery store drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде 53 года. Она добрая и чистоплотная женщина. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. После смерти мужа Мавлуда справляется с бизнесом сама. Она более 17 лет занимается скотоводством. Мавлуда покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Она хорошо знает все тонкости своего бизнеса и имеет большой опыт. Она должна отремонтировать свой дом, то есть сделать штукатурку, установить потолок и обклей-ка стен обоями. Она не имеет достаточно денег для того, чтобы купить строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mavluda is 53 years old.  She is a kind and orderly woman. She is a widow and has 3 children.  Her husband died several years ago. After her husband's death, Mavluda runs the business herself. She has been raising livestock for more than 17 years. Mavluda purchases livestock, feeds them for several months and then sells them at a local market. She has a lot of experience and a good understanding of the details of her business. She has to repair her house, that is, to plaster, install a ceiling and wallpaper the walls. She does not have enough money to purchase building materials. She has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 somons for the purchase of building materials.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 39-year-old widow, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has died due to a fatal disease. Now, she is living in her own house with her two sons and a daughter. 

Sabra is a medical nurse by profession. She has been doing this job in a hospital for the past 15 years. After the death of her husband, she has been running a maternity center in her home. She is experienced and professional in her work. She has been dealing with many cases of pregnancy and has provided much successful care. She is a very famous nurse in her area and the women have full confidence in her abilities. 

Sabra wants to keep a stable reputation and wants to establish her maternity center. Therefore, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she could buy the latest medical instruments and equipment.

Her daughter is getting medical education from a medical institution and she wants her daughter to take a medical course, so that she could easily obtain a job in a hospital. Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy medical instruments and equipment for a maternity center.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2007, he decided to become the proprietor of his own business; so, he opened a restaurant, where he provides his customers with delicious beans. 

Because of his friendly personality, Mohamad was able to maintain a good number of loyal customers that visit him to enjoy his food. But we all know that there are ups and downs, and this is the moment when Mohamad is facing a situation that is requiring him to request a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to overcome all the obstacles. 

He states that with the loan, he will buy baking tools and supplies in addition to required quantities of food that will help him increase his business productivity and, therefore, his income. 

Mohamad is very motivated to receive the loan, as he is sure that it will substantially grow his business.

loans.use: buy baking tools and supplies in addition to required quantities of food.

loans.name: Noemí Lucía

texts.es: El cliente corresponde a la ciudad de Machala.  Comenzó tiempo atrás con la venta de carne, chuzos, choclos asados, y con el crédito que solicitó en ese entonces y parte de sus ahorros, pudo montar su propia tienda con la cual ha trabajado hasta ahora.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposo  es maestro constructor, se ayudan mutuamente.  Tiene una niño de 3 años.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería (víveres) para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. Some time ago, she began selling meats, kebabs, and roasted corn. With a loan that she requested at the time and part of her savings, she established her own store where she works now. The borrower is in a common-law relationship and her husband is a master builder. They help one another since they have a three-year-old son.

The borrower wants to invest this loan in merchandise (food products) for her business.

loans.use: to buy food products for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. He has six children and has been doing farming work for ten years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "rearing livestock." His biggest challenge is: "climate change." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Nyabarati."

Richard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "they offer better services."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "low interest rates."

His highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked: "how will this loan benefit his family?," Richard replied: "it will provide milk and manure."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Richard owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and pump,' but does not own: 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net,' but does not have: 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina, a 38-year-old married mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol, earns a living through her hog-raising business, which she has had for more than nine years. With the intention of improving both her enterprise and her income, Celestina is requesting a loan to buy feeds for the pigs.

In the future, Celestina hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Osimkhon

texts.ru: Осимхон молодой и умный человек. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Осимхон после окончания средней школы поступил в университет. Данное время он является студентом 2 курса Политехнического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Осимхон учится отлично и хорошо. Он любит читать книги и газеты. В свободное время он посещает интернет кафе. Он всегда старается расширить свой кругозор. Осимхон активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Osimkhon is a young, intelligent person. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. After completing middle school, Osimkhon entered university. Currently, he is a second-year student at the Polytechnic Institute Technological University of Tajikistan. Osimkhon is an excellent student. He loves to read books and newspapers. In his free time, he visits an internet cafe. He is always trying to broaden his horizons. Osimkhon actively participates in all extracurricular activities at the university. He needs to pay for his tuition, but does not have the money. He has requested a loan in the amount of $1050 U.S. dollars.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, a 22-year-old Lebanese single man, owns a small plot of land where he keeps bees. In this business since 2008, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase quarters to preserve the bees and provisions to feed them in order to produce large quantities of honey. Bilal is sure that the loan will improve his business and increase his earnings by a large percentage.

In the future, he plans to open a proper store to better display his products and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase quarters to preserve his bees and provisions to feed them

loans.name: Alimuhammad

texts.ru: Алимухаммад успешно окончил среднюю школу в этом году и поступил в Аграрный Государственный Университет Таджикистана. Он поступил в факультет Финансы и бухгалтерия. Алимухаммад был одним из успешных учеников в средней школе и надеется, что в университете он будет хорошо учиться. Алимухаммад интеллектуальный молодой человек и его родители гордятся, что у них такой примерный сын. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора, так как его родители не в состоянии поддержать его. Он имеет большие планы в будущим. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Alimuhammad has successfully completed middle school this year and has entered the State Agrarian University of Tajikistan. He is majoring in finance and accounting. Alimuhammad was one of several successful students in school, and he hopes that he can be a good university student. Alimuhammad is an intellectual young person, and his parents are proud that they have such an exemplary son. He has requested a loan to pay for his school tuition, as his parents are unable to support him. He has big plans for the future. He awaits your kindness and is hoping for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Narcisa Janeth

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando tomó la iniciativa con su hermana, quien trabaja en una empresa fabricante de calzado.  Ella le ayuda dándole crédito en la mercadería, dado que ha sido una buena pagadora. Luego ella la vende a sus clientes en toda la ciudad.  Comienza a laborar haciendo su recorrido en las mañanas y durante la tarde también.  Tiene 10 años separada de su ex-esposo, quien viajó a España y se casó con otra señora.  Ha criado a sus 2 hijos desde entonces, uno ya es mayor de edad y tiene un trabajo con el cual la ayuda; mientras que el otro asiste al colegio y está en primer año de secundaria.  Desea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de más mercadería (bisutería y zapatos) para continuar con su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the city of Machala. Some time ago, she took the initiative along with her sister who worked at a shoemaking business. Her sister helped her by giving her a loan to buy merchandise since she has been good with her payments. Later on, she began selling to customers throughout the city. She begins her work by making her rounds in the mornings and also in the afternoons.

The borrower has been separated for 10 years from her ex-husband, who traveled to Spain and married another woman. Since then, she has raised her two children. One is now grown and has a job, which helps out financially. The other one is in the first year of high school.

The borrower wants to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of more merchandise (trinkets and shoes) so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy trinkets and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано образованная женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Фариза, Авазбек и Фарангис. Им 24, 21 и 18 лет. Рано работает в средней школе. Она преподает математику и физику. Муж Рано  работает охранником в ИМОН. У Рано очень дружная семья. Ее дочь Фарангис в этом году с отличием окончила среднюю школу и успешно поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Рано должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rano is an educated woman.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and is raising 3 children. Their names are Fariza, Avazbek and Farangis. They are 24, 21 and 18 years old. Rano works at a middle school.  She teaches math and physics. Rano's husband works as a security guard at IMON. Rano has a very close-knit family. This year, her daughter Farangis graduated from middle school with honors and successfully entered the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. Rano needs to pay for her daughter's tuition, but she does not have the money.  She has requested a loan in order to pay for her daughter's tuition.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena de 46 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos ama  de casa y agricultora, casada y con 6 años de educación completando la primaria en su totalidad. Sus hijos en compañía de su pareja son los únicos que le ayudan con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: Limpia, recolección en la cosecha del grano, poda, fertilización y abono en general. Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 20 años siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy joven y agradecen a DIOS por haberles podido dar la oportunidad de tener su terreno de forma propia. 

Ella ha solicitado una financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, etc. siendo estos productos necesarios para mantener un excelente follaje y una planta con calidad de esa manera al final de la cosecha se obtendrá un buen grano.

Sus planes son poder comprar un poco más de terreno en el cual piensa cultivar una mejor variedad más competitiva, más atractiva con el fin de poder exportar y de ser los mejores en la zona y a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Doña Elena is 46 years old and the mother of four children. She is a housewife and farmer. Elena is married and completed six years of her primary school education. Her children and her husband help her with the various farm duties: weeding, harvesting, pruning, fertilizing, and composting. Elena has been farming for more than 20 years since her parents were the ones who taught her at an early age how to work the land. Thanks to God, they were able to give her a plot of land of her own.

Elena is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative so that she can buy fertilizers, compost, foliar plant food, and other items since these products keep the leaves in excellent condition and result in a quality plant. In the end, she hopes to achieve a good harvest.

Her plans include buying some more land since she plans to cultivate a wider variety of crops so that she can be more competitive. Her output will also be more attractive so that it can be exported and be known as the best in the area and in the country.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Renovacion Group

texts.es:
Duo Solidario Renovacion
Carlos es unido tiene 21 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa para toda la familia, desde hace dos años y seis meses se siente muy contento por que las ventas han mejorado ya que su negocio se encuentra con mas mercadería y puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, el le pide a Dios que su negocio siga siendo muy bendecido ya que esta a punto de convertirse en papa y ahnela tener un hogar propio para el y su familia, esta solcitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que sera de mucha ayuda para ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo Solidario Renovacion

Carlos lives with his partner, is 21 years old, and has been selling clothing for the whole family for two years and six months. He feels very happy because sales have improved, as his business has more merchandise and he can meet the needs of his customers.

He asks God that his business continue being blessed, as he is about to become a father and wishes to have his own home for him and his family. 

He is requesting this loan to buy clothing for sale. He hopes that they will be able to help him with the requested loan, as it will be a great help for him and his business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old married man from Lebanon who is living with his wife and three children, who are still attending school. He is the only source of financial support for his family. He has been involved in the agricultural field for the past 20 years. In 2003, he started to work independently on his own land, cultivating various types of vegetables. Today, he wishes to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a tractor for his farm. He states that this tractor will facilitate his operations, as he will till the land and prepare it well for cultivation. Ali is very optimistic and hopes to be able to further expand his business through the coming seasons.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for his farm.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Delia is a married woman and has three children. Delia has been engaged in the farming business for more than 20 years. This is the source of her income. Delia is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvests. In the future, Delia hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Charifa

texts.en: Charifa is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source of the family. He is a taxi driver working really hard to meet his family’s needs. As for Charifa, in order to supplement the family’s income, she has been working as a farmer for more than 20 years. She is specialized in cultivating various types of vegetables. With her loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy seeds and agricultural tools, and she will fill the channels with the water needed to grow her crops properly. In the future, Charifa looks forward to applying for added Kiva loans so she can open her own shop, where she can conveniently sell her harvests.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural tools, and to fill the channels with the water needed for her crops.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is 30 years old and married to Nelly. They are blessed with two children, 2 and 6 years old. He is a small-scale tea farmer and also sells green tea leaves in Kaboi, Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the last five years. He receives a monthly income of KES 30,000 from this business. Kennedy is served by KADET’s Kapsabet Branch. He has borrowed KES 80,000, which he will use to buy more green tea leaves for resale. He will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to buy green tea leaves.

loans.name: Edma

texts.es:
Edma tiene 25 años, está casada con Abraham y aun no tiene hijos, por el momento solo vive con su esposo en su casa construida a base de madera. Edma se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, está actividad se ha converitido en su  principal medio económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Posee un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas donde junto a Abraham realiza la cosecha de cacao orgánico y fruto de los árboles frutales que posee. Gracias al constante trabajo que lograron  desempeñar juntos fue posible construir su primera vivienda con ayuda de algunos vecinos suyos ya que era su principal objetivo cuando empezó con su vida conyugal ya que anteriormente  vivía en casa de sus padres y considera que ya era hora de independizarse.
Gracias a su trabajo espera mejorar su vivienda de a pocos para tener preparado el camino para los hijos que le gustaría tener. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para construir columnas de cemento para su casa de madera.
texts.en:
Edma is 25-years old.  She is married to Abraham and doesn't have any children yet.  For now, she lives alone with her husband in a house constructed of wood.  Edma has made her living in agriculture since she was very young.  It has become her primary source of income for meeting her household expenses.  She has a 2 hectare plot of farmland on which, together with Abraham, she harvests organic cocoa and fruit from the fruit-bearing trees they have.  Thanks to their constant hard work and the help from some neighbors, they were able to build their first home.  That was their main goal when they started their married life together, as they previously lived in her parents' house.  They felt that it was time to live independently. 
Thanks to their hard work, Edma and Abraham are hopeful they can improve their home little by little to pave the way for the children that Edma would like to have.  This is her first loan with Kiva, and Edma feels grateful for the financial help she is receiving so she can keep moving forward.  In addition, she promises to re-pay her loan punctually.  At this time, she is hoping for 500 nuevos soles ($250 USD) to build cement columns for her wood house.

loans.use: to purchase cement for her wood house.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 27-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. In 2010, he opened a store, where he works as a furniture painter. He produces stunning results and has one part time-employee helping him with the work. Today, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy wood to be able to create more products, as he desires. His only target at this stage is to earn a higher income so as to better support his family. As for his future plans, he agrees with the idea of taking out more loans to grow his business by opening a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: to buy more wood and make more furniture.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children aged between 8 and 13. She has been running her business for six years. Her monthly income is KES 6,600.This is her first loan term with KADET Ltd, where she borrowed KES 15,000 to be used to add more commodities in her grocery store. The anticipated profits from her business will enable her expand to another business, so as to stabilize her finances. Her hope and dream is to be economically independent.

loans.use: to add more commodities, such as vegetables and cereals, to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Elsieta

texts.en: Elsieta is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Elsieta is a married woman and has six children. Elsieta has been engaged in the farming business for more than seven years. This is the source of her income. Elsieta is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest. In the future, Elsieta hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 42-year-old lady, married to Ezekiel and the mother of four. She is a tailor and has been in business for six years, with a monthly income of KES 35,000. This will be Ann's seventh loan from KADET LTD. She has repaid all her other loans successfully, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy three new sewing machines, so that she can increase her production. In the future, she wants to open a tailoring school and empower others like herself, who have a passion for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy three new sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 45 years old and has a service-based business, providing transportation around his neighborhood. He works hard to feed his family of seven. His wife helps him cover their living costs by sewing clothes in a garment factory. Ly has been in the transport business for the past five years, and he earns a net income of $10 per day. Ly is taking out his second loan, after repaying his previous loan successfully. He will use this loan to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) to improve his business. With the expected profits from his business, he will cover his family’s basic necessaries and save more for future emergencies. He’s grateful for the loan support.

loans.use: to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) to improve his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. She has five children and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Tea plucking.” Her biggest challenge is “Diseases.” Animals on the farm have been given the name of “Maridadi.” Janet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “Better services offered by Juhudi Kilimo.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and said: “The kind of loans they offer.” 

Her highest monthly expenses are business-related. When asked “How will this loan benefit her family”, Janet replied “It provides milk and manure.” As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janet owns the following: “cow, poultry, pump” but does not own “pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile”. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the house but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD”. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, blocks, iron and sand.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De San Juan Sacatepequez Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosas de San Juan Sacatepequez Doña Magdalena de 30 años de edad, ha mantenido su negocio por más de 9 años, negocio que ubica en su domicilio una venta de consumo diario pudiendo así ofrecer los productos más buscados por las personas tales como arroz, azúcar,  frijol, acetite, verduras, etc. También  por las mañanas doña Magdalena  prepara refacciones como panes, con frijol, panes con Jamon, frutas con pepita, entre otras golosinas, aprovechando así la hora que los niños ingresan a  la escuela, teniendo así un ingreso más, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario ya que nececita surtir mas su tienda para que sus clientes tengan mas variedad para comprar, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que es de mucho veneficio para ella y su negocio.
texts.en: Communal Bank "Dúo Rosas de San Juan Sacatepequez" (Pair of Roses from San Juan Sacatepequez).  Doña Magdalena is 30-years old.  She has run her business for more than nine years.  It is located in her home.  She sells daily food items, the things in highest demand such as: rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, vegetables. etc.   Also, in the mornings, doña Magdalena takes advantage of the time her children are in school to make spare items like bread with beans, bread with jam, fruit with seeds and other sweets.  This gives her an additional income. Doña Magdalena is requesting the loan in order to purchase daily food stuffs.  She needs to stock up her store so her customers will have a greater variety of items to purchase.  She hopes you can help her with her requested loan, as it will be a great benefit to her and to her business.

loans.use: to purchase food-items for re-sale.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du groupe FILWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Un va à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 06sac d’igname et des miches de  pain.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désir épargné. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et construire sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Bintou is the representative of the FILWENDE group. She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Her oldest child is 26 years old and her youngest is 10.  One of her children goes to school.

Bintou has been preparing meals for the past 13 years.  She buys her supplies at the Toecin market.  Her customers are men, women and children.  

She wants to buy six bags of yams and some bread loaves.  

With her profits, she wants to save.  Her ambition is to improve her family's living conditions and to build on her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy six bags of yams and some bread loaves.

loans.name: Djekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes de Djekafo 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Mah  (première femme assise à droite compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the Djekafo 2 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 36 years old and also have an average of four children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan.

Mah (seated, first from the right), plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Miriya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Miriya 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Adiaratou (deuxième femme assise à gauche avec la houe au cou dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Togo.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Miriya 1 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 35 years old and also have an average of two children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan.

Adiaratou, a member of the group, is an important farm work leader during the rainy season in the village of Togo. In the photo she is in the front row, second from the left, carrying a hoe on her shoulder. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato tiene 58 años, esta casado con Maura y tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive junto a su esposa en su casa construida a base de material noble. Honorato se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 3 hectáreas donde posee plantaciones de cacao orgánico y café. Optó por la agricultura porque fue el oficio que también desempeñaban sus padres , aprendió de ellos la mejor manera de obtener una buena calidad de cultivo usando solo abono orgánico para no deteriorar la calidad natural de sus terrenos de cultivo. Cuando las tareas de sus cultivos se tornan algo complicadas contrata a trabajadores del lugar que le apoyan considerablemente a terminar con el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones. Considera que su trabajo es muy abnegado y siente que tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir desempeñándolo sin inconvenientes. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Honorato is 58-years old.  He is married to Maura and has four children who are grown and live independently from him.  He lives with his wife in a house made of hardwood.  Honorato makes his living in agriculture.  He has 3 hectares on which he has planted organic cacao and coffee.  He decided on agriculture because it was also his parents' trade.  He learned from them the best way to have a high quality harvest using only organic compost, so as not to damage the natural quality of the crop land.  When the planting work becomes somewhat difficult, he contracts workers from the area.  They help him considerably in providing the appropriate care for his plants.  Honorato considers that his work is very selfless and that he still has plenty of strength continue working without any problems.  This is Honorato's first loan with Kiva.  He feels grateful for the financial help he is receiving so he can keep moving forward.  In addition, he promises to punctually comply with his repayment plan.  At this time, Honorato is hoping for 1,000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to purchase organic compost to nourish his sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Saniya sont majoritairement mariés dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Médine à Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des activités génératrices de revenu, des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de bois de chauffe, de charbon de bois, d’habits et de mèche pour les cheveux. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (3ème  femme debout à gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est connue  dans le quartier de Médine pour la vente des bois et charbon de bonne qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et en sacs de charbon de bois. La revente se fait à domicile au comptant et crédit à clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans l’activité et l’autre pour la prise en charge des besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The six members of the Saniya group are mostly married and living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with three children. They all live in the Medine neighborhood in Segou (the third administrative district of Mali). They know each other through their work or as neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage. They retail firewood, charcoal, clothing and hair extensions. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are no on their fourth solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the third one standing from the left in the photo) is known in the Medien neighborhood as a vendor selling quality firewood and charcoal. She plans to use her loan to buy some cartloads of firewood and bags of charcoal. She sells out of her home, for cash, to a customer base composed of both men and women. With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 42,000 West African francs, one part of which will be reinvested in her business and the other used to cover the costs of condiments for her household.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena de 48 años de edad , está casada con Zenobio y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Filomena se dedica a la agricultura y se inició en esta actividad cuando cumplió 20 años porque ella y su esposo recibieron un pequeño terreno de cultivo para empezar a generar sus propios ingresos. Con el paso de los años lograron sacarle el máximo provecho a las tierras recibidas siendo actualmente propietaria de 2 hectáreas de terreno donde posee mayormente plantas de cacao orgánico ya que son muy rentables en su zona. Todos los días debe dirigirse a sus terrenos de cultivo para realizar las tareas de mantenimiento correspondiente como son el retiro de maleza, corte de tallos defectuosos entre otros contando en mas de una ocasión con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así mantener en buen estado sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Filomena, age 48, is married to Zenobio and has three children.  They live together in a house made of wood.  Filomena is a farmer.  She started this business activity when she turned 20 because she and her husband got a small piece of farm land to start generating their own income.  With the passage of the years, they managed to take maximum advantages of the land they got.  The property is now two hectares of land where they mainly have organic cacao plants.  These plants are very profitable in her area.

Every day she needs to head towards her farm land in order to do the maintenance work like weeding and cutting imperfect stems, among others.  On more than one occasion she has used the help of the workers in the area.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support that she is getting in order to get ahead with her business.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She now wishes to have 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to keep her land in good condition.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para hacer mejoras en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara comprar láminas, pintura, clavos, polines, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro construir el corredor de su casa y hoy quiere hacerle otras mejoras. Las circunstancias familiares  se han mantenido y sus ingresos han mejorado. Su deseo es tener su propio negocio, ampliar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Juan needs a new loan to make some improvements in his business.  This new investment will help him to purchase metal sheeting, paint, nails, poles and other items. 
The previous loan was a big help to Juan.  He was able to build the hallway for his house, and now he wants to make other improvements.  His family's circumstances have been stable and their income has improved.  Juan's wishes are to have his own business, to enlarge his home and to help his children to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, paint, nails, poles and other items.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 35 years old, married and the mother of one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling timber materials. She earns a monthly profit of 48,000 KES. Phillis was introduced to KADET and is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES to buy additional timber to sell to her customers. Philis anticipates using the profits made from this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as to continue expanding her business further. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of timber for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has six children. Erlinda has been engaged in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Erlinda hopes of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Danaya sont majoritairement mariées dans les ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Médine à Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des activités génératrices de revenu, des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de drap, de charbon de bois, d’habit et de bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (1ère  femme debout à gauche dans la photo) est connue  dans le quartier de Médine pour la vente des draps et habits de bonne qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 douzaine de draps et quelques habits au Burkina-Faso. La revente se fait à domicile, au marché et en ambulant dans la ville de Ségou au comptant et à crédits à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Ami espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans l’activité et l’autre pour la prise en charge des besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The majority of the five members of the Danaya group are married within monogamous households.  On average, they are 41 years old with three children each.  They all live in the Médine neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They have come to know one another through their income-generating activities, and also through ties of neighborhood, kinship and marriage.  They sell bed sheets, charcoal, clothes and firewood.

In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third cycle of solidarity loan.

Ami, a member of the group, is a well-known seller of good quality bed sheets and clothes in the  Médine neighborhood.  In the photo, she is the woman standing first from the left.

Ami plans to use her loan to buy a dozen bed sheets and a few clothes in Burkina-Faso.  She resells for cash or on credit from home, at the market and also door-to-door in the city of Ségou.  Her customers are men and women.

With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business, while the rest will be used to purchase condiments for her family.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and clothes.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con Nemexo y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Ida se dedica a la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao, barbasco y otros productos propios de la zona desde hace 18 años. El barbasco es uno de los productos cuya presencia llega a ocupar gran parte de sus terrenos pues es usado después de un proceso industrial como insecticida natural, motivo por el cual tiene un alto precio en el mercado externo, es por ello que dedica gran parte de su tiempo en el mantenimiento de las plantas que crecen como raíces. No obstante para ello debe de realizar una inversión considerable en cuanto a mano de obra se refiere. Pasado 5 meses de la última cosecha desea nuevamente realizar plantaciones para el cual debe contar con un promedio de 10 trabajadores quienes deben de realizar una ardua limpieza en el area de trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.  Con los 500 nuevos soles pagará a los trabajadores del lugar que se encuentran apoyando en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ida, age 38, is married to Nemexo and has three children.  They live together in a house made of wood.  Ida is a farmer.  She has been growing cacao,  ‘barbasco’ [an evergreen bush], and other products for 18 years.  Barbasco is one of the products that occupy a large part of her land.  After an industrial process, it is used as a natural insecticide.  That is why it has a high price in the foreign markets.  That is why she spends a great part of her time on the maintenance of these plants, which grow from roots.

However, in order to do so she needs a considerable investment in labor.  Five months after the last harvest, she wishes to plant again.  To do so she needs an average of ten workers who must do the arduous work of clearing the work area.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful to receive financial support that allows her to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  With the 500 soles, she will pay the workers in her area who help on her land.

loans.use: to pay for labor in her fields.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Felix est un homme âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants , tous allant à l'école.il gère depuis 21 ans un petit garage où il répare des motos dans un quartier de la ville. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de pièces de rechange afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ces profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Félix is a 45-year-old man.  He is married and the father of four children who all go to school.  For the past 21 years, he has been running a small local garage and repairing motorcycles.

He is requesting this loan to boost his stock of spare parts in order to increase his turnover and profits.  

Félix will reinvest part of his profits in his activity and use the extra money to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Aminta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe compte 24 femmes qui habitent la même localité et développent entre elles une bonne entente.

La représentante de ce groupe, Aminta est une femme mariée de 45 ans. Elle mère de 02 enfants. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et du petit commerce de fruits et légumes. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants en mangue, banane, carotte, pomme, navet etc. Sur La photo, elle est en vert avec la main levée.

Avec Son prêt, elle va acheter 30 paniers de mangues qui coûtent entre 2000f et 3000f le panier et revendre aux grossistes.

Ses bénéfices lui ont permis de construire 04 chambre. Elle gère la famille car son mari est à la retraite.
texts.en:
This group comprises 24 women who live in the same small town and who get along well with one another.

Aminta, the group's representative, is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  She fattens sheep and also sells fruits and vegetables.  She buys produce such as mangoes, bananas, carrots, apples and turnips from surrounding villages.  In the photo, she is the woman wearing a green outfit and raising her hand.

She will use her loan to buy 30 baskets of mangoes, each basket costing between 2,000 and 3,000 francs.  She will then resell her goods to wholesalers.

With her profits, she was able to build four rooms.  In her family, she is the one managing the expenses, since her husband is retired.

loans.use: to buy 30 baskets of mangoes for resale to wholesalers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 36-year-old man, married to Joyce, and is a father of one child. He lives in Kerwa on the outskirts of Nairobi. He does farming and veterinary services. He has been in business for seven years and gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Joseph’s second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a cow.

In the future, he would like to expand his business so that he can be successful.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child. For the last five years, he has earned a living by supplying water in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. Furaha was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and he is applying for his fourth loan now. This loan, of 20,000 KES, will help him to purchase the additional water tank that he needs for his business. He will use the profits made possible by the loan to pay school fees for his child as well as to expand his business. Furaha's goal for the future is to own a well-established water distribution depot in the area, so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger water tank for his business.

loans.name: Nashehe

texts.en: Nashehe is 53 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last one year, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about 8,990 KES from this business. Nashehe was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions for her kiosk, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to continue expanding her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her food kiosk.

loans.name: Nidia Jeanneth

texts.es: Doña Nidia Jeanneth de 41 años de edad,  mujer de negocio, desde hace ya 9 años tiene su negocio, en la que ofrece productos, como gaseosa, cereal ,  embutidos, frijol, pastas, productos de limpieza, aceite, especies, también cuenta con la venta de recargas electrónicas, doña Nidia atiende todos los días desde muy temprano hasta las 10 de la noche ofreciendo por las tardes venta de pan, doña Jeanneth  necesita de capital para lograr surtir un poco mas su negocio y también quiere apoyar a su hija quien a iniciado su carrera en la universidad, y por  ese motivo quiere adquirir una computadora, para  que su hija puede hacer sus trabajos universitarios, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y ahora que su hija también ya labora tiene un ingreso mas con la  que ella puede salir adelante, desde ya les agradese por su ayuda ya que su negocio ha tenido un crecimiento considerablemente gracias a la ayuda de Dios y la de kiva, espera seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia Jeanneth is 41 years old and a business woman. 

She started her business nine years ago where she sells products such as sodas, cereals, meats, beans, pastas, cleaning products, oil and spices. She also charges people to recharge electronics. 

Nidia works every day from very early in the morning to 10PM offering bread in the afternoons. 

Nidia needs capital to expand her business a little bit more as well as to support her daughter who has just started at the university. She wants to purchase a computer so that her daughter can do her university work. 

She depends on the support of her husband and now that her daughter is also working she has a bigger income to get ahead with. 

She is thankful for the help as her business has grown considerably thanks to God and Kiva. She hopes to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy daily edible goods to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 62 years old, married and the father of seven children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. Alexander was introduced to KADET by a credit officer, and is applying for his fourth loan of 52,000 KES to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his young children as well as expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs for his farming business.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en: As the married mother of 5 children, Maricor works hard to support her family. She has a food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Maricor is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her in attaining her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is a married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the tricycle transport business with her husband for more than 4 years now. This is the source of their income. Eulalia is asking for a loan to renew her license to operate her tricycle. With this, she will be able to continue running their business thus augmenting their income.

loans.use: to renew the license to operate her tricycle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 38 años de edad , esta casada con Grimaldo y tiene 2 hijos  con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Julia se dedica a la agricultura, al inició le fue algo complicado porque empezo siendo trabajadora en distintos terrenos de algunos conocidos pero luego de ahorrar lo suficiente pudo comprarse una terreno agrícola y comenzó a sembrar café. Con el paso de los años compro otro terreno adicional donde empezó a comprar cacao orgánico  y árboles frutales logrando solventar sus gastos familiares. Todos los días se dirige a sus terrenos , en donde retira constantemente la maleza que crece para evitar que estos consuman los nutrientes de sus cultivos y así poder obtener una buena producción. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de un terreno agrícola y así incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old, is married to Grimaldo and has 2 children who live with her in her house made of wood. Julia makes her living in agriculture. At the beginning it was somewhat complicated for her because she started as a worker in different fields of some people she knew but after saving enough she was able to buy farm land and began planting coffee. 

Over the years she bought another field where she began to buy organic cocoa and fruit trees which helped cover her family expenses. Every day she is working in her fields, where she is constantly removing weeds that are growing to prevent the weeds from consuming the nutrients of her crops and thus obtain a good harvest. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful to receive financial support that helps her to move forward, and she promises to make her payments on time. This time she wishes to have 3,000 nuevos soles to buy agricultural land and thus increase production.

loans.use: to purchase land for farming

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodrigo, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua, es soltero sus ingresos como guarda de seguridad son destinado para apoyar los estudios de sus hijos  y a su madre. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en su hogar, desea cambiar el entechado el cual está en muy malas condiciones de habitar y con las lluvias es muy incomodo para la familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single and a resident of a marginalized neighborhood of Managua. The money that he earns as a security guard goes toward supporting his mother, and his children's education. 

He is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his home. He would like to change the roof which is in very bad shape and causes discomfort to the family when it rains.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheet metal and beams.

loans.name: Monja Blanca Lancetillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Concepcion es casada, de edad 53 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se decia a la agricultura a siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio porque su esposo le enseño el trabajo y hasta la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de cardamomo, desea en el futuro sembrar mas cardamomo pra obtener mejores ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia figuran 19 integrantes, pero, solamente a 13 e ellos se le concedio el préstamo.
